text: Zack from chat support helped me set up a VPN on an ASUS RT-AC66U router (with no internet) connected by cable to a Huawei b525s router with no supported VPN capabilities (but with an internet connection).  I am not a tech-savvy person and Zack took the time to guide me through all the steps using screenshots and non-tech words. I am extremely grateful for all the help!  I will definitely continue recommending NordVPN to people.

title: NordPass login issues patiently resolved
text: Tuesday 4 Oct 2022. The problem started when I couldn't log into my NordPass app that I had just installed on my new device. The old device that I set NordPass Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) on was damaged and was no longer in use. The NordPass App kept asking me to type the MFA Code displayed on my Authenticator App! But I couldn't do that because the I had just installed the Authenticator App on my new device, and it too kept asking me to scan the QR Code that I received from the Nord in order for me to proceed! What? I set up my NordVPN and NordPass in 2019! How should I remember where the QR Code or Backup Codes are, (if I even had any in the first place)? In the end, out of frustration, I contacted Nord Customer Support via the online chat function. I’m not great when it comes to typing on keyboards. I type really slowly. And so, I just want to give a shout out to Norman from Nord Customer Support for his long-suffering patience today, while he helped me reset my NordPass MFA. He didn’t rush me even though I was taking quite a long time to type my responses. He patiently let me answer all the questions he asked me. I even got worried a bit when he asked me for the first 6 digits of my Credit Card Number, the expiry date, and the amount that I paid for my Nord package. I even mentioned this to him that this was a lot of personal details he was asking me to give out. But he calmly reassured me that this was only for security purposes in order to verify that I was the actual Nord account owner before he could deactivate MFA for me. Fair enough. In the end, after about 10 minutes of patiently bearing with me, the personal information I gave checked out, and Norman finally deactivated my MFA. I can happily say I can now log into my NordPass. And yes, I will be very careful to save the Backup Codes when I re-activate MFA this time around. Overall, great Customer Service from Nord.

title: Lennie is a CX superstar.
text: Lennie is a CX superstar. I signed up for a 2 year special so I don't remember much when I originally signed up. As a Canadian, paying anything in USD is really expensive. And initially buying the NordVPN service 2 years ago on a special I completely forgot I was being charged in USD. About to start my 3rd year, the renewal email is only sent once and its 30 days in advance, so naturally I forgot all about it but it tells you that you'll be charged whatever amount (in my case at time of writing $99.48 for 1 year). It didn't mention currency and so it didn't even occur to me that it could be in USD...(netflix, disney, amazon, other services is in CAD so easy to forget)...well today I was charged the amount but it came out to 150$ CAD! that's crazy expensive for 1 year of service. In comes customer service superstar LENNIE. Mind you, same day I got charged is the same day I asked for a refund. The refund option was on the table, but Lennie also offered me a deal where I get additional months added to my subscription at no extra charge (on top of the 150 I already paid). The amount of months I got made it SO worth it. It works out to the point where if I broke it down into per month cost I would forget I'm even paying for a VPN service.  I consider myself sort of a power user of NordVPN. Its setup on my home router, on my laptop and my cell phone. That alone should tell you how much I use it, its an important part of my online experience. So thank you, Lennie, so much for giving me a great opportunity to continue subscribing to NordVPN instead of issuing the refund immediately where I would then go somewhere else and find a different VPN service. tldr; signed up 2 years ago, renewal was today, paid 150$ CAD for 1 year sub, too expensive, refund was an option but Lennie gave me a deal for extra months no additional charge. Was a sweet deal so I took it.

title: Auto-Renew cancellation Reversal
text: My 2-year VPN account ends tomorrow (30/9/22). It was my intention to renew, but after the way they have behaved, not just to me, but several friends, along with many others, on various review sites, I have decided to go elsewhere. I set my account to NOT auto-renew, just after setting the account up. This setting was reversed, by Nord, some time after. I was hours away from them debiting my bank, recently, when I stopped the process.  Others were not so lucky, I am annoyed that Nord support insist that myself and others are effectively lying, about turning off the auto-renew and also that they have always sent out confirmation EMails, when you cancel. Nord do not deserve my money, so they will not get any more. ------------ following a reply: To N.L. (of Nord) You obviously did not read what I wrote.  I DID cancel the auto-renew and Nord DID reverse it. This happened to lots of people, who I can name. But of course you are not really bothered.

title: A waste of hours of time: Prevents itself and you from connecting to the internet
text: Today my PC told me I had internet and still all applications and browsers could not access it. Spent hours trying to fix it, similar to other times before. On other occasions it has said "limited" or connections problems. But I now understand why... it is your stupid software. I have had numerous connection problems and hours of repeated disruption to my internet connection because of your software over the years, so I have uninstalled it and may request a refund. I have not had the same problems with pureVPN and other providers with better software interface and features. With my problem today, other customers in microsoft forums and on reddit recommend uninstalling Nord vpn. For me this INSTANTLY fixed the problem and all browsers and apps work - which your software offers no features before login/startup (which obviously fails cos "no internet") to prevent. This is truly dumb software if all diagnostics on windows will point to a firewall or other issue preventing a connection when it is YOUR software - this type of issue should have been fixed long ago. Avoid! Edit/addition: To respond to Nord - no it was not a kill switch issue. Nice try to deflect rather than address the issue. Seems that is your company's culture.

title: Clara is AWESOME! :D
text: My account expired and Nord's system attempts to renew a bunch of times while sending emails for each failure, much annoying!  However, I reached out to their customer service and got in touch with Clara.  After looking into my account on why I couldn't just cancel the subscription, Clara provided me with 3 options for fulfilling my cancellation request.  Unfortunately I couldn't do it via chat but that only has to do with security reasons, very smart! Clara's professionalism and attention to detail made the whole experience pleasant and straight forward.  Even when asked to wait for a few minutes so she could look into things only lasted about 30 seconds, impressive! This has to be the fastest I've ever had a cancellation request go so even though I will not be using their services, I felt it appropriate to call out the awesomeness of the customer support staff for everything that they do!  Thanks again Clara and keep kicking butt!

title: SCAM is how I would describe this service
text: SCAM is how I would describe this service. I purchased their 2 year plan because it was heavily discounted. Few months later, they send a notification that they'll be shutting down their servers in India, which made this service practically useless for me since I wanted to use this service only for accessing Indian sites which are otherwise not accessible from other countries. I contacted their support to ask for a partial refund for my remaining subscription since the service is not of any use for me anymore. They refused and sent me the terms and conditions.  So, just sharing my experience here to make other users aware that Nord can shutdown their servers in any country at any point of time and that can make your subscription useless and they won't give you partial refund Support Ticket#: 11658444

title: I agree with other user that the VPN…
text: The VPN was relatively easy to install and worked fairly well on some of our devices ( flaky on the IPhone app/platform ) and was initially happy with the $59 I contracted with them per year.  The bad is that they default the auto renew and they renewed us, without notification of the price change, at $99.  Of course their customer service would not do anything about this.  I find this very unethical and therefor would not personally use their product(s) in the future.  Look at all their negative reviews.  This company has corrupt business practices.  This isn't the first time they have ripped off their customer.  Be careful of using any credit card with them. This is the canned response you will get from them:  Please note that we have drastically improved our service, added new features, thus our user base has grown several times. That being said, it is only natural that we had to review and modify our current pricing to maintain the quality of our service and to continue growing.  The issue is that they are unethically changing their price without your knowledge. With their logic you could end up with a $200, $300.. bill and no recourse.

title: Cancellation confirmation never sent
text: I was recently disappointed, by the response from the Nord support team.   After seeing many customers reviews and hearing their experience, whereby Nord insist they have always sent out confirmation of auto-renew cancellation, by EMail. I opened a (one year) account on 26/9/20 and immediately cancelled the auto renew. They most definitely did not send out a confirmation EMail.  When I informed Nord of this, they effectively called me a liar. I have friends, who are out of pocket, because Nord have auto-renewed after cancellation. Nord will probably respond to this review, saying how sorry they are and asking for my Nord support ticket ID, with a view to look again at the matter. My research suggests they don't bother. I would advise anyone who opens an account, to use a bank/credit card which will expire, before any possible renewal. You cannot remove your payment details from their database. They get way with this because they are registered in a tinpot south American country, who allow this.

title: Deliberately misleading pricing information
text: NordVPN advertised as deal as a 2-year 2.49/month + 3 months free, but instead of £59.76 for 27 months that 2.49*24 + 3 months works out as, they charged £67.23. I contacted them to point out the mistake, but they refused to acknowledge it, trying to convince me instead that the monthly price is just there to show what the monthly price of £2.80 would go down to once the 3 months are taken into account.  While they clearly stated the deal included reduced price **PLUS** 3 months free ('2.49*24 + 3 months free) they were actually selling a 3 months free deal in the hope that people aren't going to bother to do the maths. The conversations with their customer service as well as their senior customer service teams in which they continued to refused to acknowledge that they mis-sold and refused to honour their advertised deal demonstrated to me that this isn't a mistake but a deliberate attempt to mislead customers.  For comparison, their competitor Surfshark advertised a similar reduced price + x months free deal at the time which actually totalled to the correct discounted price and added those free months to the contract length, as you'd expect.  Be warned, we're being conned.

title: Took out a 3 year subscription and…
text: Took out a 3 year subscription and never authorised any auto renewal. Frankly the service never worked properly - everytime you go to Google it's asking for a captcha to be completed. Asked for a refund as they illegally auto renewed it without consent and frankly I cannot physically afford this bill with my current financial situation. Online chat promised that they would look into it - no response, contacted Paddle (Who they use to process payments) who put me through to them again and got fobbed off again - asked to escalate this as it simply wasn't good enough and they cannot provide any proof that I actually authorised an auto renewal and have again been ignored.  So I suggest to everybody do not give this company any card details as they will help themselves to more money and won't give it back.

text: Actually, NordVPN is a good enough for me.  As an advanced user with linux-based OS, I use NordVPN every day more than 4 years. All I can say - good for 5 stars on TrustPilot.  Good price and good connections. Yes, today I was not able to connect to specific server and specific country (which I used for months); after checking their site I cannot found it, so they probably replace it. So I do the same - change OpenVPN configuration files and now I am online using NordVPN - again. Never used their app, but OpenVPN. As I said - good enough for me. Keep it up good company; they should stay with these conf. files as well.  Android: maybe it could be more light; my opinion is that this app should contain more threads, so it can run smoothly. Thank you.

title: NORD VPN
text: Jack was super helpful! He was very straight to the point. I wanted to cancel my subscription and he wasn't too insistent. Thanks for making it super easy.

title: Amazing Tech Support from Timothy!
text: I signed up with NordVPN at the beginning of the year just prior to our move to Belize. I wanted the additional security NordVPN provides and the ability to stream content through our Roku device that we cannot put a VPN on.  We've been struggling with connectivity and speed for the last 6mos.  We purchased a new router from FlashRouters (recommended by Nord), but their tech support was completely useless. We were literally at the point of changing ISPs. Finally, I got in touch with TIMOTHY at Nord tech support via their chat feature.  Timothy was amazing and seems to have been able to help an old guy, not particularly tech savvy, in resolving the problem. We discovered the problem wasn't with our ISP and saved me a ton of time and money!   I can't thank him enough for his time and expertise!   Thanks again, Timothy!

title: Connectin Issues
text: Facing some issues, Mr Joeffrey helped by investigating the ticket and helped me with all the information and support i needed. Everything is fixed . Thank you guys, I can count on you.

title: Beware-They renew anyway
text: I set up a 2 year VPN account 2 years ago. I immediately turned off the auto renew. I hardly used the service and it was not very reliable. Suddenly, last week, I was charged £83 (around $92). Nord had reversed my instruction NOT TO RENEW. They have persistently denied this. After a while they grudgingly agreed, to refund. This came through quite quickly, but, when converted by bank, it was significantly less than the initial £83. Nord refuse to reimburse the shortfall and still deny any wrongdoing. My advice would be to never have anything to do with this dodgy organisation. Update: The NordVPN Customer Service Team appear to have stopped responding to my communications...Not Good! (ID #11567396) Another 2 days on, and with ticket ID supplied....still nothing! Yet another 6 days on and the so called customer care team still refuse to communicate with me.

title: Happy Longtime User
text: I've been using NordVPN for over 5 years on all my devices, and have been very happy with them. They've proven to be fast and reliable. I recently had an auto-renewal issue, and they resolved it via chat quickly. I can highly recommend their products, as well as their customer service. Excellent company!

title: I ran into an obscure issue
text: I ran into an obscure issue with a trusted website that blocked my access, after loading NORD My tech skills are better than average but after attempting to resolve the issue thru the vender, i was still blocked from accessing my data Thankfully KYRA was able to make a few simple suggestions to test my connection integrity and then adjust a setting wow so simple and issue resolve these people are GOOD

title: The VPN APP crashes without…
text: The VPN APP crashes without notification constantly! I asked them to refund but because the 30 day cut off was expired I am forced to see the 2 year contract. Not so according to NORD HELP. I am very unhappy and warn others to be certain to cancel within the 30 days or else be forced to continue as per contract conditions. The longest time connected was 136 hours as displayed by the Nord VPN App.

title: Originally, I was looking to cancel my subscription…
text: I was looking to cancel my subscription within the 30 day guarantee. I initially planned to do this much earlier in the process but due to work and personal obligations I had forgotten about it until my wife brought it up to me. Georgie was very patient about letting me try things and giving suggestions to get NordVPN working. There were some things that just suddenly worked, some which are honestly inexplicable, but it working was enough. I just want to get what I pay for and support is a part of that equation. Georgie's patience more than me feel value with NordVPN (that and the services I require VPN for working). He gave me some clear steps which worked and most importantly was patient. Most supports are too busy trying to keep to their close ticket time averages that they completely drop the ball on providing actual support. Georgie did not and for that, I am writing this review to show NordVPN has a great member on their support staff.

title: Server of PlayStation 4 changed thanks to Eugenia!
text: I intended to connect my PlayStation 4 to my NordVPN server to be able to change the region of the server I wanted to play a PS4 game on. Eugenia was very eager to help me with this problem, and made it clear to me that this wasn't going to solve my problem. The region of my PS4 is determined by the country of the billing information of my PS account, so I should alter that to alter the server of my PS4!! I'm very glad to have this information thanks to the kind help of Eugenia, because this problem has already been haunting me for weeks. I'm very grateful for her service and very happy to have been able to discuss my problem with her! Now I know how to solve my problem!!

title: Scam!
text: I've been using Nordvpn since 2020 and never have any major issues and I also recommended to my friends and family. Recently, after I canceled the auto renewal and bought 2 redeem codes (Total validation of my account is until Aug 2025). But today when I open the app it's stated that my account does not have active subscription. Then I contacted the customer service. However, the Nordvpn agent is useless, couldn't help me retrieve my subscription back and they asked me to contact the reseller of the redeem code to activate my subscription. So this mean that even after I bought the redeem code, the reseller still can manage that subscription. So this mean I got scammed easily. I wonder why the reseller still can manage redeem code that I already redeemed. BEWARE OF THIS VPN. I WILL NEVER BUY ANY PRODUCT FROM THIS COMPANY AGAIN. COMPLETELY SCAM!

title: Update Issue - NORD VPN would not open.
text: I opened my Nord VPN program and learned that there was an update. I installed the new update and rebooted. Unfortunately, the new version of Nord VPN did not (and would not) open. Nord technicians instructed me to delete 'all' of the Nord files on my system and perform a clean install, afterwards. (There were extra files on my system pertaining to Nord VPN so I was reluctant to delete them.) After following Nord's instructions (just one email note), problem solved. This was not a huge technical issue, I was just concerned about deleting the extra files. During my many years w/ Nord VPN, I have only had a few problems and each time I have found the staff there to be very well prepared and knowledgeable about their product. It's been a real pleasure dealing w/ them on those few occasions. Because of their attention to detail, my confidence in my VPN program is very high. In fact, I have paid my account in advance which doesn't expire until the year 2031! That's a real vote of confidence! Keep up the excellent work, Nord VPN!

In the end, he resolved my issue in a timely manner! Zion took over the follow-up after I had to step away mid-process and was also polite, attentive, and professional. I felt I was in good hands with both, and they both deserve a raise! The consistently speedy and effective tech support is a huge part of why I've stuck with NordVPN for so long.

title: Unfriendly TOC
text: NordVPN is a very attractive service, but I was left disappointed by their customer service and TOC. If you forget to disable auto-renew most businesses will refund you if it's only been a few hours – NordVPN are the first business I've come across who don't, so if you forget, and are charged for your upcoming package, they'll keep your money. You'll see in NordVPN's response to this that they can't refund an accidental renewal. It's not that they can't, it's that they've chosen not to – when almost all commercial digital services do.

title: Three year subscription, could only use two
text: I have used NordVPN for about two years. And when it comes down to the quality of their services it is pretty good. But when it comes down to customer service it is very poor. Three years ago I purchased a three year subscription. And I was happy about it. Until last year. When all of a sudden my subscription was cancelled. I didn't understand why and I tried to look into it. But for some strange reason my account stopped existing. I contacted customer support. They looked into it and said I have never had any account with them. That's strange.. Since I have been using it for a good two years. But ok.. Except for pissed and disappointed I was estranged that this could happen. Now one year later I all of a sudden received an e-mail from them that they would automatically renew my subscription.... Wait I thought I didn't have a subscription wasn't it? I contacted customer support again. And now all of a sudden they said. Oh yeah you have an account. And I can request a new pass with my xxx@xxxx email address... Well for sure I am not going to use NordVPN a second chance anytime soon. Especially since I explained the whole situation again to their customer support. And they were like.. Ok we'll cancel it for you. And when you like to use it. Pay for it again. (like I could use it anyway.. which I couldn't because their system had some sort of bug) ticket : 11471488

title: Fantastic Customer Service
text: I purchased a NordVPN subscription so I could watch movies and TV shows with my long-distance partner. We are both University students and wanted to spend more time together. Sadly, the services did not work as the University WiFi did not allow connections through specific ports. I did not take the time, nor the care to check this. I advise people in my position to check this out before purchasing, there is a helpful FAQ on their webpage. I am so grateful for NordVPN's 30 day money back policy, and I was quickly and efficiently confirmed that I would indeed be refunded. They responded to my request within an hour and we got it all sorted within 24 hours.  Thank you NordVPN, when the time is right, I will take out this subscription again.

title: Fraudulent auto-renewal after last subscription in 2019. Please join class action lawsuit.
text: In 2019 i purchased a 12 month subscription. A few month ago, almost 3 years later, they renewd my subscription without my active consent and billed my credit card. Since I dont have the proof anymore that in 2019 I purchased a 12 month period only, the credit card company said that they cannot do anything.  Checking my spam emails, I saw an email of nordvpn about a change in their terms of service. The new terms state that you actively have to object the auto-renewal of your subscription.  After searching the internet, I found that this happened to a lot of people. Some report that even when they tried to cancel the auto-renewal on time, nordvpn made it almost impossible to do so. I found this HP were people can report nordvpn and i hope enough will do in order to stop that malpractice: wittelslaw nordvpn-cancellation-investigation. Hands of that fraudulent company! Ticket ID #11519972

text: The worst customer service ever!! I prepaid for this aweful waste of money. Yes it is fast but I have complained to them on several occasions that I have to disable the VPN to access most websites I use on a daily basis. I would understand if it were my bank or something truley secure but its almost every website. Most of the time I get messages that says the website I am trying to access is only accessable to residents of the United States. I am in the the US.  When I finally get a response from customer support all they do Is ask me to list all of the websites I am having issues with which was very timeconsuming but I did provide this to which I got a very technical response to that I could not even understand as I am 70 yrs old. I am still very good at computer issues but these were more than my computer geek husband could translate. I requested a refund of my newer 2 year subscription as its useless as its disabled most of the time and they refused. Please go to other VPN's people. My daughter has one thruogh her company and she never has ANY of these issues. update: I would love to provide a ticket number but I didnt save the email. I just would like a prorated refund and cancel the VPN, PLEASE!

title: HORRIBLE SERVICE
text: When I got a new phone (2 days after their specified trial period) the VPN prevented the new phone from connecting with my home wifi, so I was unable to access the internet through my broadband connection. Everything was slow, and some of my apps woudl not work at all. The only solution was to delete the VPN from my devices. I spent 2 full days with the phone manufacturer's customer support service and my broadband customer support service figuring this all out, but by this time it was 4 days past the end of their trial period, and NORD refused to make even a partial refund of what I had paid. This meant I had paid over $100 for one month of service which did NOTHING for me but cause headaches. I thought this was unacceptable service, so I am telling everyone I know to never use NORD VPN. I never was given a ticket number and the interaction was entirely online chat - NOT my preferred way of interacting with customer service, but that is the only way NORD VPN will interact with their customers.

title: Excellent customer service!
text: Even though I don't need a VPN right now and cancelled my account (not because I was not satisfied with it, simply because I had only wanted to try it out and realized I don't really need a VPN for now), my experience with NordVPN in general, and the costumer service live chat agents in particular, was excellent.  I had to contact them twice, first for a refund, and then because my credit card was cancelled and I wasn't sure the refund would come through, and both times I was connected to real agents - Harper and Matthew the first day, and Jack the next - within seconds. They were all extremely kind and very helpful. Both times my problems were solved very quickly.  Having to contact companies for refunds or because of problems is very stressful for someone who has a lot of social anxiety like me. But the process was so easy, especially with the live chat, and so quick, and the agents were so lovely and helpful, that I cannot recommend NordVPN enough. Next time I am in the market for a VPN, I will surely come back to Nord, and recommend it to friends.  Thank you again to Jack, Harper, and Matthew.

title: Very Serious Crime Happening Here
text: I am having a very serious trouble with NordLocker , a service that apparently provides safe encrypted storage for your files . I have uploaded all my data in there , it was properly uploaded , all was in the cloud , and all of a sudden the files are not there . I have backed up all my laptop , all my work , photos , personal data everything , and they don't grant me access to my files . I feel like my data is being stolen from me without any conduct , respect or ethos . It is really disappointing that , after having reached out to them , explaining that all my work is in there and trying to get my files back , they don't even reply to me and don't solve my issue . I am unable to work , having spent all day awaiting a reply . I am left with the feeling they are trying to steal my files , and feel this is sincerely ugly . I would appreciate if you could return all my data to me ASAP , as this is very sad and poor of you . I wouldn't ever trust NordLocker to anyone to save your personal files . What is happening to me and what I am witnessing is that my data is being stolen by this company . To never repeat really . I would appreciate if Nord Security Company would have the decency of getting back to me with utmost urgency . My files were all uploaded into my could with them and one by one , GB and GB of information , and sincerely , I saw it very clearly and they were all saved in there . I need HELP asap on getting back the data that belongs to me , to a service that I pay , and that is not granting me access to my files . Please contact me asap !

title: I have had a terrible experience with…
text: I have had a terrible experience with NordVPN. There are so many bugs when using with iPhone, which they say they are aware of and are trying to fix, but the problem has been ongoing for months now with no solution. App randomly logs out without notification. When it is on, I can’t use any location based apps. I also randomly can’t get on several websites (like CBC news, for example). When I leave my house and switch from wifi to cell network, it takes up to 10 minutes to reconnect, or sometimes does not reconnect, meaning I can’t use my phone in that time unless I turn the vpn off. I’ve paid for one year of service and have so far been able to use the app for about 50% of it. I asked to cancel and to refund my remaining term given all these issues, but they won’t do it beyond 30 days.  Their support team has given me suggestions to fix that have just made the issue worse. After many emails back and forth, I asked them to just call me to sort this out and they say they don’t offer phone support. So I guess it’s back to 100 more emails that don’t fix anything. Definitely will not be renewing and can’t recommend this service to others.  Two stars because the app would be very easy to use if it ever worked.

title: Remember Conversion Fee if you're in Canada
text: NordVPN was solid for the past 3 yrs. I recently renewed at a promo price of $69.36 but was charged approximately $118 CAD. I went to their website and chatted with an agent (Evan). He advised this is due to NordVPN showing prices in USD. I unfortunately wasn't aware, NordVPN - please, it would make Canadians' lives easier if prices were more transparent and in Canadian dollars. However, the slight confusion was also the math. $69.36 * 1.13 (Tax Rate of 13%) = $78.38 approx. $78.3768 * 1.30 (USD -> CAD rate on 08/28/22 = $101.89 CAD approx. I was charged $118 CAD // why is there a $16 conversion fee // just seems really steep. I know the agent (Evan) wasn't able to give me a partial credit, but he did give me a full refund. All in all, not entirely happy with the lack of transparency, but the agent was solid and prompt and provided as much help as he could with what power he had.

title: Irritating router VPN connection problem solved.
text: I've struggled with a very irritating NordVPN connection issue for some time. Basically, my secondary router running DD-WRT wouldn't let its Open (Nord) VPN client connect to my preferred server using Nord's recommended DNS addresses. By leaving the DNS fields blank or using Cloudfare's, I could connect, but neither were useful because the VPN's functionality was compromised. Larry in Nord support helped me solve the problem which arose  because DD-WRT couldn't resolve their host names. Manually inputting their IP address solved the problem (for TCP connections at least). I have to say that whenever I've had an issue with Nord, their on-line support staff have always been excellent, but Larry gets a special mention for walking me through and helping me solve this very annoying connection issue.

They were not helpful in solving the problem. Response. The help they gave was to download the app from their website. It did not change anything. title: Not much more I could ask for with excellent Customer Service
text: Excellent customer service with knowledgeable people. I was receiving an error 500 when attempting to renew my membership (previously a 3 year user) and chatted in to talk with Jordan. Was easily able to attach screenshots with the error and given a timeframe of a few hours- which isn't a big deal whatsoever. For the troubles I got a free month coupon code and whenever the website is back up I can complete my checkout.  For what I use it for, NordVPN has everything that I need; personally I don't purchase and wouldn't use any of the premium features like data scans/sweeps and password migrations or encrypted cloud storage, but I'm sure that they're helpful to people who do look for those items and I don't doubt that Nord stands behind their products with the same excellent customer service that I received tonight when I chatted in at 3AM MST w/ Jordan. title: Great support

title: Tiffany in live chat was a real pleasure
text: So I just want to say that I am very happy and extremely grateful for the live chat representative (Tiffany) that fixed my problem. She was very patient, beyond competent, just all around excellent as she truly helped me restore access to my nord vpn (MFA needed resetting). This is of course is no longer an issue, but Id be remiss if I weren't to make known my satisfaction with; Firstly-- I am again utterly pleased not only with the outcome, but the entire ordeal from start to finish with tiffany sincerely did make me feel like my account is about as secure as such a thing can be in this day and age where digital weaponry and social engineering are but footnotes on the horizon of whats likely to come... I was happily demanded to provide a reasonablely extensive and error free set of details about my purchase. This somehow felt both non-negotiable while not feeling like a threatening possibility of my account access being wrongfully/mistakenly deemed unrecoverable was imminent. The ball was left in my court while I parsed through the necessary inboxes and records to find all of the information I was required to verify, but if for any reason i failed to come up with precisely what was asked of me, I feel like I wouldnt have ever been able to restore access to my account, a peacefully lovely feeling in this context. Secondly--At more than one point in the process i lost my connection and had to reinitiallize the live chat, which normally makes for a tedious and redundant experience. I was promptly reconneceted WITH TIFFANY, and i felt that she was absolutely a real human being standing by awaiting my verification info and it took the better part of an hour for me to connect the dots needed to paint the picture correctly. upon reconnecting i never had to repeat anything i previously mentioned, and responses were quick and without issue connecting with t Tiffany everytime first time, its extremely telling of the fact i was being helped by A PERSON! i can actually say this was hardly even notable with this experience. It was very refreshing that i had to bear the burden of proof as youd expect should be the case, but sadly isnt always do.  I feel pretty good in saying that with how tiffany handled my situation, it would have been very unlikely anybody OTHER THAN MYSELF wouldve been able to satisfy her requirements and reach the point of restored account access.  All in all She did a very fine job, procedurally correct and totally in the realm of reasonability.   Give her some recognition and pat yourselves on the back as I thank you for the help I received. Truly appreciate the secure and very efficient way everything worked out.  Thanks again. 😊

title: Excellent VPN-provider
text: I have been a customer of NordVPN for quite a while now. I was introduced to NordVPN after my subscription to a different VPN service ended.  From the start, I really liked NordVPN. The connection is very fast, and there are VPN servers in basically every country. NordVPN also supports advanced features like double VPN and onion over VPN. I also spoke to their customer service once. They helped me very quickly and quite well, even though the issue couldn't be directly resolved.  I do notice that sites detect my connection as suspicious, so expect to fill a lot of captcha's if you have your VPN enabled. Even though that is a small price to pay for a lot of security and privacy. Additionally, I really like the ability to have the VPN enable automatically when you start up your PC. This is very useful for people that use their VPN all the time, so that you don't forget to turn it on. All in all, NordVPN is a great VPN provider and I would definitely recommend them to everyone.

text: The NordVPN Account site is sleek and accessible with an easy to understand UI. The Customer Service Agents (I talked to Adam and Larry) were polite and helpful, answering questions and troubleshooting quickly. From what I saw, the departmental management is highly efficient and allowed the seamless transfer from one Customer Service Agent to another almost instantly when different expertise was needed.  TL;DR I am very satisfied with NordVPN's Customer Service Department and would like to give them a 5/5 for geniality, helpfulness, and operational efficiency.

title: NORDVPN Cancellation
text: After trying out NORDVPN for 5 months in the start of 2021 i ended my subscribtion, i didnt receive a confirmation email but didnt realise this, fast forward to this date and i notice that a weird payment has been deducted from my bankaccount. Apparently i've been paying each month so like €180,- down the bin. Tried to contact customer service but they couldnt do anything as they told me. They did tell me to cancel my subscribtion ''again''. I did this and to no suprise i didnt receive a confirmation e-mail of my cancellation again. i contacted customer support again and they told me that because i chatted with them through the chatbot, this would be enough to show as evidence that i cancelled my subscribtion. all in all, really bad service as it comes to this. Thinking about if i should chase this case or not.

title: I stopped the service on 17 June 2021
text: I stopped the service on 17 June 2021. They started debiting a stopped credit card in August 2021 and took apron $20 Aust Dollars each month for 9 months or so. My Name Is Ric Howard when I asked for a refund they said the payments were allocated toHello, Richard,   Thank you for your reply.   We have located an account under kanemurphy no   @ gmail.com.   Could you specify if this account belongs to you? Best Regards, Rosa Torres Customer Success Team NordVPN.com when I tole the the account doest relate to me they advisedUnfortunately, we will not be able to refund your payments as our 30-day money-back guarantee applies to the initial purchase only. This period is for customers to evaluate the features of our product risk-free. After a subscription period of 1 month, 6 months, or 1 year, we would assume that the customer knows our features, uses the product, and agrees to our Terms of Service. Nonetheless, we can confirm that your recurring subscription has now been canceled. You will no longer be charged unless you subscribe to our service again.   Let us know if you have any further questions.   Best Regards, Julio Sanchez Customer Success Team NordVPN.com SUMMARY DO NOT TRUST THEM WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD

title: This is how you keep your customers!
text: I've been using NordVPN for several years now. A few years ago, I purchased a two-year plan. It's a great easy to use product that I've been happy with. Yesterday, the auto-renewal hit, but, at $99 a year I didn't view it as a value for my usage so decided to cancel. I got on the chat with Kasper and explained my situation and was immediately told that Nord likes to keep their customers and I was given plenty of plenty of incentive to stay. I've always liked the product but I didn't expect to be blown away by the customer service.  Thank you again Kasper, and thank you, Nord, for actually making me feel like a valued customer.

title: Scammy business model
text: Scammy business model. Many other reviewers mentioned this. They don't allow you to cancel! They force you to renew your subscription by stealing money from your account WEEKS before the new subscription date starts. I was not warned about this. When I told them that I wanted to cancel - still a week before my subscription renewal - they refused to refund the money they stole from me.  I had to go to my credit card company to get my money back. What kind of garbage company does this? This isn't 1999 when subscription scams were rampant. Just unbelievable that this happens this day and age.

Consequently no service, locked out of Account despite 100 days left of subscription. No refund no service.

title: Horrible experience

Scammers, and worst of all is that after trying other providers they have been the easiest going. But be advised: you are going to get angry.

title: NordVPN, the best VPN service on the market
text: NordVPN is an exceptional VPN service, with a user friendly interface, really fast servers and a lot of options and settings for customizing the VPN service (presets for P2P, for fast downloads, double VPN, etc.) and for ensuring the best security for your connection. After trying a lot of VPN services, I think I finally the definitive solution for me. Another plus is the customer service: I had some troubles with Linux LAN services been routed through the VPN tunnel, so that they weren't accessible from the other LAN devices, and in a coupled of minutes the customer service (in particular, both Sid and Violet followed my case)  suggested me a solution that finally solved my issue. I definitely recommend NordVPN for those looking for the most complete VPN solution.

title: Taking card payments without permission
text: I have an annual plan with Nord, I previously had a trial prior to the upgrade.  I understood to have ended the trial, when I took up the annual plan.  I was shocked to see both an annual plan payment AND a monthly payment be charged to my card without permission. Obviously an admin error, the monthly account has neither been used nor logged into.  Nords response was to inform me that despite the error, they want to keep the monthly payment, so now I'll have to take up the offer from the card company to cancel the payment.  Poor poor practice, highly deceptive for a company that you will be entrusting with your private details. Shocking to think they're prepared to lose an ongoing customer, for the sake of stealing a few sneaky dollars.  Given how desperate the renewals team act when trying to get me to sign up year after year - this is quite surprising. ticket (ID #11319242

title: Locked out of 2F-Auth App and NordVPN account
text: i had some issues with a 2F Authenticator App on a old mobile that got damaged and this was preventing me from enjoying a secure VPN experience both on mobile and PC as i no longer had access to the codes to login. i wasn't sure how to manually "re-add" NordVPN on a the same app on a NEW phone and i couldn't figure out the problem via my own Googles and research either. and upon signing in i wasn't given the option of using a password, it was either the 2F code or nothing.. so seemingly i was locked out of my NordVPN account. i hit up customer service today and got in touch with a agent by the name of Bart who solved it all for me in the matter of mere seconds! 10/10 service and help! this issue had been bugging me for months actually, i'm now thrilled to be back on!  Oscar

title: Save your frustration.
text: I took out a 24+1 month  membership a couple weeks ago. It stopped working today and said my subscription had expired. Nord took the money from my account. When I got in touch with them they said they couldn’t resolve and I would have to wait 1-3 business days for a response. What a joke. I took out the service as I need to use it. It’s not really acceptable to just suddenly withdraw without warning.  I also use nordpass, I am now actively considering if I can even keep using it as I do not want to risk losing access to my passwords. I will say though, Nords services (when they allow you to access them) work well.

text: NordVPN continues to shaft loyal customers with increased prices. Tried to discuss with online agent and when I said I would be moving elsewhere the response was "Alright" which is laughable customer service. I get the increased costs argument but to be told that it is also because their customer base has "increased considerably" shouldn't mean increased costs per user, it should mean less! Stating "we have added so much to our service" doesn't make any difference to me as I don't notice it or use some of the new features is also a joke! All I have noticed is increased difficulty accessing certain sites, particularly from my mobile device. New features are meant to improve the user experience, not make it more difficult! My cost has doubled this time round. I will be moving to another provider at the earliest opportunity.

title: Customer Support Matters, & Nord is A+
text: Wayne was very very helpful during our chat. It could not have been easier to have my questions answered, and my "transacts".... "transacted" 😁. The same can be said for Jess who I was briefly chatting with to confirm something it turned out I had already confirmed with Wayne.  **I have had many a support chat with several businesses, and this was one of THE smoothest I've ever had. Why? No repetitive or irrelevant canned responses were sent, communication was quick, fluid, and easy to understand. Further, his understanding of the issue led to him providing me excellent suggestions, and relevant & useful information that I found very helpful.  Please note that I was not in a cheery mood at the start of our chat (read the transcript).  Wayne turned that around very well. I know this is a windy review, but I just can't state the importance of this enough - support like I recieved today matters as much as the quality of the service you provide. Thanks, Nord - you're doing it right.

title: Good product - Bad customer policy
text: Bad customer policy. If you want to renew a dedicated IP service, you have to create an alternate email account to associate with, because they don't have or cannot link the feature to your main account. Also if you renew a feature like this one please don't forget to send them an email saying you have made a payment; otherwise the feature which you already own and you are currently paying is stolen from you and reassigned to another customer. Yes, these two awful experiences are my own experiences when dealing with NordVPN Support. Even though the product is good itself, the customer policy stinks and this is my last year with them.

title: Bad "Money back" policy
text: The VPN application is by it self fine for what it is. However I find that their products have become just a tad too expensive, for what they are. Futher more and my real gripe, their "Money back" policy isen't the best. I'd forgotten to cancel my auto renewal, that I first of all had not turned on my self and recent just charged for another month, where i know for a fact I won't be using the server. When I asked for my money back as I new I wouldn't use the server, I was refused with a simple statement of "We can't do that" Which sadly has left me with a somewhat sour taste in my mouth about the whole experience. Probably won't use it again in the future, as there are another VPN providers floating around out there.

I wasn't aware it would auto-renew, so i reached out to support for a refund. title: So I've been using NordVPN for a while…
text: So I've been using NordVPN for a while and it works pretty well - worth the price, and especially good if you can get a discount - but today I'm talking about its new Meshnet feature. it was just recently added and allows devices logged in to Nord to talk to each other across a secure tunnel as if they're on the same network. it makes what I need to do (live stream video over mobile back to desktop) a complete breeze. No port forwarding or any of that... just a secure remote connection that works as if you're in the room

After about half a dozen different attempts we both agreed to give up. Jackson did provide me information for an official build which requires a ubuntu linux which I am now attempting.

title: Nordvpn Support very helpful and proficient
text: Nordvpn Support (Aidan) was very helpful in getting me back up and running on Linux ... I was having issues connecting to any servers.  After reinstalling the App using a sh curl command in the Terminal, Nordvpn installed flawlessly.  A simple clearing of the Firewall and all was good.  I highly commend the Support Team at Nordvpn.  Well done.

title: I had a problem with my dedicated IP…
text: I had a problem with my dedicated IP address that I need for business purpose. Some organizations want only to be connected from an IP address, verify your identity and if you come from a different ip address you have to go through that verification again. So you better keep your ip address. some reorganization of their server farms made me lose my static/dedicated ip address, but Ned found the correct server and all is well. What I love about nordvpn other than the nolog policy is their warrant canary. Is there anything that bothers me? Yes, there is no 'search' and it takes some looking (without search functionality) to get to a live chat. But once there you are golden.

title: Excellent customer service from Ned.
text: When I had issues logging into my account Ned assisted me with it. He was very professional and fast. I am pleased with their customer service. Thank you, Ned!

title: NordVPN - Outstanding service and support!
text: Had complicated connection issues on my Linux system with NordVPN and support (Sid) chatted with me and trackwd down the problem and helped to solve the issue and stayed online even after several reboots during several hours and answered all questions just perfectly. Great support, outstanding! The software and VPN service, once set up correctly, runs perfectly and plenty of servers (near my location in Europe) have almost no speed lags compared to my original ISP servers and even with the US and some Asian servers I can get almost 900 Mbit/sec (max. of my ISP is 1000 Mbit) if I use their outstanding Wireguard /Nordlynx protocol (much faster than OpenVPN with same security and 1/10th of source code size). I have tried many VPNs before and I can say Nord - with its no-logs-policy, chain-VPNs, P2P-servers, obfuscated servers and TOR-over-VPN-service is the fastest, most stable and reliable VPN service with the best and sophisticated 24/7-support out there. I am just a happy customer and get nothing for writing this review, but above is all true and it should be mentioned, since most VPN comparison sites and "reviews" are paid valuations and clickbait bulls$%#!!!

title: I love NordVPN
text: I love NordVPN.  I had used another VPN service and with their recent buyout, had me looking for another service provider. title: Best experience with customer support so far
text: I was stuck on an annoying issue for a week but didn't decide to ask for support since support at most companies is usually frustrating. However I decided to to ask for help from NordVPNs support (using the chat at the bottom right of their website). I was connected with Timothy who walked me through a bunch of different steps to help me resolve my issues. He spent a bit more than 2 hours helping me and was very considerate and respectful. After a while I was forwarded to another representative - Leroy - who also walked me through some steps and eventually he helped me resolve the issue. No long wait times, no elevator music, no getting stuck with chat bots, one of if not my best experiences with customer support so far.

title: Tried many other VPN providers, Nord is the best
text: I had tried using Express VPN and it did not work for me, it was very hit and miss and I cancelled with them. I signed up to Nord VPN about 3 years ago, and have been very pleased with the service. Ok, occassionally the VPN fails and needs to be reconnected to a different server, and sometimes you get a slow connection. I would say it works a treat 99% of the time and as long as it stays that way I will stay with them. I also had to change my account settings recently and received a response almost straight away, and it was all sorted very efficiently, so the customer service is good as well. Highly recommend Nord VPN over others I have trialled.

title: I've been using Nord since May 2017
text: I've been using Nord since May 2017. I find them to be quite reliable and use the service fairly often. I initially paid $79 for 2 years, then $99 for 3 years. My renewal payment went out this morning and I didn't spot the earlier email mentioning that this year I would be paying $99 for only one year. I contacted chat support and at first was told... "A lower initial price is available to allow our customers to try out our services and to find out if they would like to continue using our product. The recurring price for our subscription is the real price for our services after taking into account all the available features and the overall quality of the service." I pointed out this was 3 times more expensive and was then passed on to Thomas who told me... "We aim to continue creating quality products that people would love and use every day. Following the greatly advanced quality of our service, the upkeep and forthcoming new cool features, we've increased our pricing to match the services we now deliver." I sad sadly this was too much of an increase for me and requested to cancel my account. I was then offered an additional 18 months at no extra cost, which I accepted. Good customer service, if you ignore the part where they tried to squeeze 3 times the money from a 5 year old customer, but that wasn't Thomas' fault. If I can skip this step next year I will increase my rating to 5 stars ;)

title: Nord is filled with issues & bad CS
text: Nord has quit working with Amazon Prime US and is now noticeably slower to connect. I am at the tail end of a 3 year contract, so I have a bit of experience with Nord. I will NOT renew Nord, so I have to choose another VPN... this task is daunting. NORD VPN • Three years ago, NORD customer service was terrible and was hard to reach. About 2 years ago, the customer service greatly improved... and quickly resolved issues I had at the time. This month (July 2022), connectivity to Amazon Prime US just stopped. Nord customer service now responds in about a day via email, but the agents are mind numbingly thick. I have been trying to get Amazon Prime US working again and have been put through never ending series of suggestions from clearly unqualified CS agents. I would highly recommend avoiding Nord simply because their Customer Service stinks. • I suspect that the "noticeably slower to connect" has to do with their somewhat recent anti-virus that they want installed. And they want me to uninstall Malwarebytes Free and Avast One (free)... I have come to trust this combo to catch viruses... sometimes Avast catches some web viruses and sometimes Malwarebytes catches some web viruses. To get NORD to even work, I had to reduce the functioning of Avast... which I don't like. I don't really trust Nord nor their anti-virus to protect me from threats. I will not renew NORD simply because they don't try to play well with other major apps such as anti-virus programs... that I clearly need. • I was never able to get Nord VPN to load prior to either FB Messenger or Skype. Not a big deal, but you never know if you need privacy until it is too late. I did put it to the top of startup programs, so it loaded before the browser. • Strange enough, Nord does not have a server in the country that I live (Philippines). There are some websites that require a local IP address. Before starting to us a VPN here, I was hacked twice. This is reason enough for me to not subscribe again to Nord. • Nord password robot keeps trying to require me to change my password. I have an incredibly long password that is unique and simply do not want to be bothered by a stupid robot. And when their robot pops up, the Nord VPN stops. This is reason enough for me to not subscribe again to Nord. I don't know how Nord keeps getting good reviews by reviewers (maybe they pay well?)... but clearly Nord is filled with issues. Just don't do it.

title: Fraudulent service
text: They scammed me out of money. I hadn’t realised how awful their customer service is. I was charged by the auto renewal, I emailed them within half an hour and they refused to refund me despite cancelling the subscription within that first half an hour. They are a fraudulent service who do not care about their customers so BE CAREFUL. As you can see - they like to restate their terms of service, but best believe they do not have any customer care or policies that look after their customers. Take a good look at all the other 1 star reviews on this site and you will see the same problem, if I knew beforehand I would’ve avoiding them. Some people have been worse off than I have thankfully

title: Reliable with Decent Speeds
text: I’ve been using Nord for around a year and it has always been reliable with decent speeds. I occasionally get issues with pages not loading until I pause the VPN but this is usually only on my iPad, it doesn’t happen very often on my iMac. Overall I’m happy with Nord.  The one small thing that drives me crazy is that every time it updates I have to log back in again to enable my VPN…this may seem petty but it’s annoying when you need to do something quickly and you have to go through logging in again.

title: WARNING: auto-renew without consent and horrible performance
text: WARNING: check your account regularly to make sure auto-renew isn’t suddenly enabled! I never gave consent for an auto-renewal but when I found out they had already been siphoning off 15 EUR per month for 3 months. That aside, I was very disappointed with my experience. My internet speed was cut in HALF! It barely worked to watch geo-locked content and required so much effort to set-up every time you switch countries, it’s not worth the hassle. On a positive note, NordPass as a password manager is pretty OK, but the icloud keychain can do most of the things it can and that’s free…

title: THIEVES
text: Recently received an early bird email from Nord (24 months for $2.88)which at $1=£0.84,should have been £58. Nord charged me £72.63.After all kind of requests from Nord for screenshots of the offer  email, current account screenshots, bank statements, I got a refund of £67.01 with the following explanation.  Thank you for your reply. Please note that you were charged and refunded in USD, if your card is in another currency (GBP), the discrepancy in the amount is the currency exchange fee charged by your bank and it is sadly, out of our hands. Also, keep in mind that your bank may apply a different currency exchange rate when selling and purchasing foreign currency. We highly recommend contacting your bank regarding this issue for further help. This is surely illegal and I would not recommend using these penny pinching thieves to anyone. Go and get Surfshark for £1.99 a month. Much better anyway.

title: Trouble connecting in a restricted nation
text: I was unable to connect for the longest time because I was in a restricted nation. I was unable to even access the Nord website or to download the app due to the nation's firewall. After some great customer service from Freddie he was able to direct me and give me the correct links to download the app and to help me get connected to the VPN. Freddie was great and I have had nothing but great customer service from this company. I would recommend NordVPN all day long. Thanks again for the help Freddie!

text: Could not connect to the internet with the app on even thoug I used it on the same network before. After about 3h or so we finaly managed to figure it out. It seems that having cloudflare instaled (had it before Nord VPN) had to do something with it even thoug you can't use a vpn and cloudflare. I send prior a picture with all the apps instaled so it seems it's not a common problem. We flushed the DNS changed the DNS and instaled the manual connection app. All this diddn't help. After reseting all, uninstaling cloudflare and restarting + something on their side (I think) seems to make it work again.

title: Auto Renewal is REALLY BAD
text: MY reply. With in minutes after renewal, When a customer contacts you and let you know that nit interested in auto renewal and request you to refund the current month charge you should accept the request. If not I call it as bad customer service.  I was in India on a trip and signed up for one month service to try it out. VPN did not work for the websites I was trying to login.  On the 2nd month they auto renew and charged for 2nd month.  I talked to their customer service rep on the same day they renewed to stop the service and not charge for the 2nd month. But the rep denied.  Such a nice way of looting by Auto Renewing you even though you sign up for only one month.  They refer you to a big Agreement and charge you for second month even though you keep saying you don't want their service.

title: iPhone 3/5 vs Mac 4.5/5 vs iPad 4/5
text: iPhone 3/5 vs Mac 4.5/5 vs iPad 4/5 This is my first paid vpn service. I’ve used  some free vpns in the past (ookla ipvanish) and a free app long ago. I would say this has worked the best of the three. I haven’t been using vpns long enough to give value for money rating but I think everyone knows a high price is unsustainable and NordVPN usually always tries to stay competitive with pricing I don’t remember what I paid but I got 2 year plan at discount still a tad costly.  (iPhone) Good to have while traveling. though some-most web browsing will have you do extra verification via recaptcha gets annoying so I usually turn it off or just don’t even use (both cellular and Wi-Fi). Most streaming apps won’t allow use of vpn either. Speed has gotten better over time.  (iPad)  Same as above- definitely use while traveling  (Mac) I research a lot and I window shop/buy online tremendously for myself and others so while I use the vpn it can be a small hassle having to do extra location verification and sign in on google but on safari there is little to no issue. Still provides most availability and highest speed on Mac. Streaming services are a lot less restricted on Mac ;)

title: I made the mistake of buying a two-year…
text: I made the mistake of buying a two-year plan for starters. My biggest complaint with this service is that it throttles Microsoft Store apps that need connectivity to the internet to work. This includes weather apps TV apps and a few others. I've tried all kinds of fixes and work arounds but to no avail. I contacted customer support, and they can't come up with what's causing the issue either. The app is also slow connecting on system start. Once connected the speeds are pretty fast at least for Nord Lynx. The other protocols cause a huge reduction in speed. Another issue is it doesn't allow connections to some streaming services.  My advice to anyone reading these reviews before buying the service is to not buy long term plans for multiple years for a lower price. I still have over a year left on my account, but I have already switched to another provider. I may have saved some money up front buying a multiple year service but now I'm going to lose out on the year and half left because the I can't use the service. I would have been better off in the long run going month to month where I could have just cancelled the service before the monthly renewal. Ticket (ID #10563926) with a subject title Ticket 10563888.

title: NordVPN is consistently not connected and other annoyances
text: NordVPN is consistently *not* connected, even though it is shows *protected* (iOS widget). NordVPN must be manually connected (macOS menu bar) even though it is set to "Auto-connect" NordVPN is set to auto launch when computer starts, and "Auto-connect" but it never auto connects.  NordVPN has a "trusted networks" setting (I have no trusted networks) so it is set to "Auto-connect"--that's why I bought a VPN!  It should auto-connect when using any network--but it does not. NordVPN desktop app often loses / forgets login information, forcing reentry, which requires connecting a web browser to the Internet to login before one can turn on VPN -- apparently the Nord apps won't work without the browser first connecting to the online Nord auth app.

title: Zero Customer Loyalty
text: As I have used NORDVPN since 2018, generally with a positive experience and Premium PASS since 2020, again mostly good. I am giving them a terrible rating due to customer loyalty.  They now have a "Complete" package, which include VPN/PASS & Locker. This now costs £3.99 pcm for 2 years (with 1 TB of secure storage). My current subscriptions expire in over 2 years (Aug 2024, Jan 2025). I wanted to switch to Complete to get the storage. Yet NORD expected me to pay £3.99 pcm for 2 years and in effect just get Locker! or pay £5.99 pcm for 2TB of Locker for 2 years (as I need around 1TB for all my photos etc.).  Thanks a lot! You really don't care about keeping customers happy.

title: Pretty good overall. Sometimes a little short of bandwidth
text: I've been using NordVPN for well over a year. Overall, it is pretty good. Customer service was good when I needed it.  There are plenty of options for different types of use. For instance, I can obfuscate the VPN traffic when using the wifi in my local library, thus getting round the library's VPN block. Without the security of VPN, the library's wifi would be useless to me. Sometimes I have a little bit of glitching when streaming FHD video, but this doesn't happen all the time by any means. Whether this is to do with NordVPN's bandwidth or with a lack of bandwidth further upstream, I can't say for certain.

title: What the hell are they feeding these guys..
text: So I had this issue where I had to hammer on the log-in button of the NordVPN app a couple of thousand times in order to connect. Seeing as my mouse is only rated for 50 million clicks, and I wanted most of those clicks to go towards missing every shot I fire in Battlefield, I thought it best to contact support - and possibly a doctor about my impending RSI. To my dismay, I had to talk to a robot for a little while and do some preliminary checks. Now before anybody judges me, and in the event that Google's LaMDA is indeed sentient and likes to browse the internet in its free time as claimed, I have nothing against our future synthetic overlords. They're just not that great at understanding what you mean when you reply to them with reaction Gifs. Anyway, leap forward a few mundane tech checks and I'm being told I get to talk to an actual human. Now I don't mean rat out the AI here, I know Isaac Asimov's laws of robotics don't explicitly forbid lying, but the fact this person floated into the chat suspended on a beam of light made me a little sketchy about their so-called 'human' origins. They called themselves Eryc, and I never got a surname - which only supports my argument that Eryc was more myth than man. At first, they didn't believe my claims about the error I was receiving. Nor should they. I've worked in tech support, and the biggest lie ever told is "I already reset everything before I got in touch." Customers aren't always right. In fact, they're mostly liars. However, after a few supporting screenshots, Eryc got right on the case. Persistence is key to problem-solving, and Eryc had the stamina of Popeye at a vegan buffet. Solution after solution was posed, and yet nothing worked. Though, after digging through the depths of their knowledge, Eryc would eventually find the ticket. That solution? Stop using the NordVPN app. On the surface, the suggestion to fix the app being that I no longer use it is so hare-brained you'd have thought Eryc was simply trying to find a polite way of saying "I don't know." But in actual fact, it was a stroke of genius. They helped me set up OpenVPN as an alternate way to access the service, and wouldn't you know it - it worked. What a wizard. 10/10 - I can now once again watch pornography without the government collecting information on my preferred kinks. Thank you, Eryc. This one's for you. (Not like that.)

Frequent updates and occasional new features make it a very pleasing user experience. Being based outside the US and EU is a privacy plus. Highly recommended.

text: Nordvpn tech support is not the best.  You know you've reached an inexperienced techy the minute they say they want a screen shot.  This is what they wanted when I wanted to cancel.  They will bill you automatically without you confirming you want to continue with them.  I had a lot of problems with my password every month I was with them.  I needed a vpn that worked every time and Nord doesn't.  You spend a lot of time with their tech support.  I get much better service from another VPN service I use now.  I am sending my case with VPN to my Congressman, Senator, the SEC, and the Congressional Finance Committee to start a bill before Congress that companies Like NORD cannot automatically bill you without you confirming you want to continue with them.  Once you get into NORD's system, they are very difficult to get away from.

title: Nord VPN was disappointing at best
text: Nord VPN was disappointing at best Overall the service only ended up making my internet connections more and more terrible whenever I used it. Constant service interruptions, constant network failures, overall everything worked slower and worse when connected to the VPN to the point where I would have to disconnect it to get anything done properly.  Every streaming service would work worse with this VPN by a significant margin. Even normal web browsing would suffer due to terrible performance as well as the ever present interruptions of service. Online gaming suffered the most as these interruptions would immediately disconnect you from the game session. This is an unreliable service with a terrible history that is propped up by pure advertisement propaganda. Definitely would not recommend.

text: I had been with Nord VPN for over 5 years, today upon attempting to connect I am presented with the info that I have "no active subscription" (it was fine the day before) I contacted Nord's customer service who just replied the same line over and over " you have no active subscription under that email address" checked with my bank and it was auto re-newed for 2 years on 14/04/2021 leaving me with  what should be 10 months of service still available. but customer service say they can do nothing because they see no history under my email address. Guess who wont be paying Nord VPN any money ever again as I cant trust them with my money, for a supposed "tech" company to have no record of my account is somewhat worrying for the security of my internet content. (Edit) Nord VPN WAS ALREADY given the opportunity to rectify the situation via their websites live chat, with the assistant called "Nick" during this exchange all data was provided and as they advised me (multiple times) that as they had no record that I held a current active subscription, they were unable to provide further assistance. this begs the question: if they request further information (which would be the exact SAME information already provided) how would it be possible for them suddenly be able to provide assistance when they already advised that they could not ?

text: Serviceable for basic computer usage (email, surfing the web, etc.) so, if you are a Boomer it will probably be fine.  If you use streaming services (which is almost everyone under 65 these days) this will only give you headaches.  Virtually no streaming services will work with NordVPN.  Don't let them fool you.  They will claim you can use streaming services, but you will put in hours of work as an amateur IT technician, only to be told, "sorry, I guess it won't work for you".  Oh, and "No, you aren't eligible for a refund".

title: Easily the best VPN service out there
text: Easily the best VPN service out there. They are always having deals so it's very cheap. I've hardly noticed a drop in speed and I'm a gamer while the rest of my family streams constantly (all services are unblocked by the way thanks to Nord). When I'm not gaming, I work as a cybersecurity consultant and In my opinion, Nord just screams professional. The UI is clean and easy to navigate and the connections are seamless; I use it on all my hardware. Given my line of work, I've tried many VPNs including CyberGhost, Express, PIA, Proton VPN, IVPN, etc. and I always end up going back to Nord. Plus, their support will go above and beyond to help you with your issues. They've always solved anything that's come my way. All in all 100% recommend, even to the average user--VPNs aren't just about privacy and anonymity, but security as well. If you want to keep your bank and credit card data secure, getting a VPN is a crucial step.

title: Finally got a positive experience using NordVPN chat.
text: I have been on a local chat for about 3 hours.   Previously, I have NEVER been able to get any useful information out of any one at NordVPN.   This was a very surprising outcome.   I started with Jamey.   He appears to have been the first line of defense.   He went as far as he could which wasn't much but he tried and forwarded me to the next guy.  Then I got Darly.   Obviously, he was a second level and he was very knowledgeable.   But we exhausted his ability to help and got transferred to Kyle.   Kyle could not do very much because NordVPN owns some of the servers they use and they rent time on others.   They can control the access to their severs but they are at the mercy of the other vendors.   I use IPTV to stream.   The Atlanta servers would not allow me to stream any content.   The owners of those severs have blocked streaming applications.  So I had to use the Miami Servers.   While this works for now but what happens when the next group demands that the Miami servers block streamers.???   So Kyle had to pass me to Brooke.  (I think he had to go to lunch)  Brooke was also  very knowledgeable.   She appears to be the expert for the Firetv app.   We reloaded and set up my firetv stick so it would work.   I have told everyone I know how bad NordVPN service was for over two years.   Well  they appear to have fixed it. title: '30d money back' is total Fake! Scammers!
text: Recently I have purchased NordVPN for 1year, and unfortunately I reveled that almost all of their services are blocked in my country. And one or two servers which are not blocked are very slow in connection, and connection is not stable. So I asked Support team to provide me refund given stated '30d money back' option.  However I was wondered that they replied that for me there is no money back as that my 'debit card is under sanctions' - total fake statement. My debit card was issued in US by legit crypto-card provider and not under any sanctions. So NordVPN uses practice to make fake statements to decline request for refund under '30d money back' option. This is behavior of scammers!

title: NordVPN review
text: I use the browser plugin to be able to watch US series which are region blocked. I found the NordVPN plugin to be the only plugin I tested that allows me to stream.  The Windows client itself works somewhat but consistently has issues when connecting via NordLynx when run on Windows 7. I had reported the issues to customer support but they were unable to resolve the issue. The Android client, on the other hand, works rather well with NordLynx. However, there are some caveats:  1) If inside China, forget about NordVPN, all of the servers are pretty much blocked on an IP level. Not a chance.  2) Some services such as USPS.com do not allow connecting from the NordVPN Japan servers.

title: Using Nord for a while now...
text: Been using using Nord for a while now. Compared to another big name VPN I was using, Nord has a faster connection. If you're familiar with using a VPN service, connection speeds can vary depending on where the server is located. So users that are having speed issues, check which country you are connected to and what time it is over there, if it's prime time, your speeds can slow. Just be wary of time zones. With Nord, I haven't had any issues and switching servers is so easy. Only hiccups I've noticed is after updates, but that is to be expected sometimes. Nord is pretty quick to fix so no worries.

title: I have been using Nord VPN for about 6…
text: I have been using Nord VPN for about 6 years. I have really liked the service and protection I am getting. The price is good and the protection for my devices seems to be working well.  The issue I have is with " customer service". I try to reach them and do all the scrolling of the " self help" features and suggestions that the " chat" area provides. This is really irritating since what I issue I am having is not one of the listed items to look at. Even when I get to " chat" with the tech on their chat side I get no resolution to the issue I have. Each of the three times ( over several months) of trying to get this resolves I am promised a resolution and a reply back from their tech division after they do their research and investigation. No reply any of these times.  I go to Yahoo and on certain Nord VPN servers the Yahoo site comes up as a Mexican site, all in Spanish. Just with certain Nord servers. Very strange. I have checked and rechecked all the languages and page settings every time I chat with Nord and yet it all is correct on my end. Nothing I have entered or saved is suppose to be going onto Spanish. This is so frustrating for this to continually to happen yet not getting any resolution or feedback from their tech service department. I hate to change VPN service companies but I am looking at my other VPN options now.
