title: Deceptive Australian pricing
text: For Australian customers Nordvpn quotes prices for plans in dollars adding Australian GST. They state that your credit card will be charged in Australian dollars. However when you put in your credit card details they charge the Dollar amount quoted as US dollars converted to the much higher Australian dollar equivalent. At no point until your transaction is processed are you given any indication that the price quoted is in US dollars. Any customers ripped off in this way should contact the ACCC as this is in direct contravention of Australian Consumer protection laws.

title: Never Use Two VPNs In One Device ! (this was 9 years ago)  -  I've been using NordVPN almost from its…
text: I've been using NordVPN almost from its inception. I like testing and comparing browsers, file managers/explorers, media players, and VPN apps. So I usually took two subscriptions from different apps and liked to see which is faster, which is easy to use etc. etc., then try another two different VPNs, test drive for a month. I was not impressed with NordVPN initially, this was 9 years ago(?). The earliest iterations were clunky but what I remember then was I liked more settings to contigure and NordVPN had all these settings I needed to configure I realized I was such a user.  ExpressVPN touted itself as having only one button to switch it on. I found out this was much too boring for me. I was reading and learning about Android then. I was enjoying tweaking NordVPN and was usually chatting with support. Anyway, I was using NordVPN 24 hours a day and once I was chatting in this forum when I noticed the notification shade didn't have 2 NordVPN cards then I realized both apps crashed (you can say that I liked testing apps to their limits (Oasis Feng gave a few pointers on running two VPNs in one device so I followed his pointers and was able to run two VPNs) and those two NordVPNs crashed. I was exposed in the forums which was embarrassing to have happened. But I found out the reason why both VPNs crashed; An update came OTA so when the app updated they stopped when I was using it. I was so furious but I couldn't tell Nord that two VPNs were up in my device because they did not allow this but my point was that the app when it updated left me out on a limb.  I was so furious.  What kind of security app left me out in the cold when it updated. They shouldn't auto-update because people were using the app. This was way back six months when I first used NordVPN. Its come a long way.  I was talking to Chris/Sup then. Basically there's more neat things to do with NordVPN compared to One-button VPN. And all of them at one point or another stopped working during those years. Proton would be no. 2 on my list. By the way these two VPNs; NordVPN and Protons support a number of causes related to improvement of digital highway, highlighting importance of certain issues that also relate to environmental causes and preservation.  Proton does support educating people believing that the internet highway should be free, thus Proton offers Secure VPN for free though they also sell subscriptions to their highly configurable VPNs.  NordVPN and Proton have been on the forefront of reliable VPN servers ever since.

title: Ripped off by Amazon, let down by Nord
text: I paid 83$ from Amazon for Nord (my bad admittedly). Nord themselves then sent me marketing for the same subscription for $39.  I complained and there was no offer of a discount next year etc just ‘tough’ (or that I could have misread even tho I sent them prof of purchase) see below: Hello, Greg, Thank you for your reply. the different status of your subscription may simply be a visual bug. Furthermore, the 39$ offer for a yearly subscription is an exclusive offer that is not available on our website initially nor through any of our resellers. In addition, the prices for our service on Amazon App Store may differ from the ones on our official website as Amazon can set their own prices. Let us know if you have any aditional questions. Best Regards, Xxxx (Nord rep)  When I reviewed this on Amazon they checked the review and didn’t post it! - prob so that those autocratic, slave-driving tax-dodging con artists can keep ripping other people off using the Nord brand. Will be taking my custom to another VPN next subscription. title: Unauthorized charges, no customer service, no reliability
text: About a year ago, my wife and I both signed up for NordPass as they were running some sort of summer time special. Throughout the months that we had NordPass for the last year, we ultimately decided that we were not satisfied with not only the security, but most definitely not the service and we haven’t used NordPass enough to make it worth the price in the first place.  My wife made sure to cancel her recurring membership, and I made sure to switch my recurring membership to a month to month plan as I realized at the last minute that my subscription was about to expire. However, on what was supposed to be the last day of both of our subscriptions, we realized that not only had this company charged us both AGAIN when they weren’t authorized to, but they charged us BOTH for ANOTHER FULL YEAR SUBSCRIPTION. After my wife politely requested a refund, explaining the situation and the fact that not only does she not use NordPass anymore, but that her automatic renewal was cancelled a while ago, they promptly denied the refund (even though they weren’t authorized to charge the card and even though we contacted them THE EXACT SAME DAY to inform them of this). The first thing I woke up to this Monday morning was another $34.99 gone from our account (which was for my subscription), even though I only authorized a $4.99 charge. This confirms my suspicions that not only is this company and this service a joke, but they are immoral, unethical, do not care about their customers, and will charge your card not according to what you agreed to, but they will charge as THEY see fit.  We will never, and I mean we will NEVER, EVER, support NordPass, NordVPN, or any of their other services at any point, EVER again, or before the world ends. We would highly suggest that you do not waste your time, money, or effort with this company and take your business elsewhere to a business that is actually worthy of their customers and will not fraudulently screw them over. We will be seeing you, Nord. You will not get away with stealing our money.

title: Nord Cancelled Acct after Payment. Not a CC issue.
text: I took advantage of a capitalone offer for 2yr subscription for NordVPN services. Payment was made and accepted, setup was a snap, but 4 days after activation and usage my account suddenly showed "subscription expired". No warning, reason or a single message from Nord. Contacting them I'm told that my payment was flagged as potentially fraudulent (Wells Fargo CC so not some off the wall unknown CC issuer, or some precharged or credit building fee based CC). My account was cancelled by Nord and money refunded to my CC. All info submitted was accurate and the paymet was duly processed. I confirmed with my CC company that the refund had been submitted from Nord (thanks?) and there were no issues with my CC. The "fraud alert" and refund was purely from Nord's side. Had they asked for additonal info to verify any of my details, I might have obliged, but summarily turning away customers for no valid reason or notice... I guess they don't need my money. They did suggest trying another payment method, but my personal info would be exactly the same and it wasn't my CC company that rejected the transaction. It was Nord. It was a VERY good deal and I have to wonder if Nord simply decided it was TOO good and decided they didn't want to honor it.

title: Very trusted VPN service that is true…
text: Very trusted VPN service that is true to its name. It leaves no personalized trail of your presence on the Internet so you remain hidden at all times. It even allows the use of a Kill Switch so the Internet or other apps cannot access the Internet without the Nord app running. So you know you are protected at all times. Best of all, unlike other VPN services NordVPN has no info or documentation about you on their servers so even when bots or hackers try to follow your footprint once they hit the Nord servers the trail completely ends there with no additional info or trace of you. For some reason, most VPN's leave your account data on their servers so bots and hackers can still retrieve your info and this is what only a few VPN's like Nord actually prevent. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is due to its high price.

title: Connectivity to internet and customer service
text: I have had Nord VPN for a few years now.  Unfortunately, I have not been able to use NordVPN very often. I kept losing my internet connection.  I tried to address this about a year ago and got nowhere.  I was receiving a response once a day at that time and then no one was responding.  I was disgusted and didn't want to deal with it any longer.  No use of the product for at least a year on my laptop and I paid for Nord's all inclusive product package.  I uninstalled and reinstalled the program numerous times, to no avail.  Today, I initiated another attempt to correct this problem.  I was disconnected from the 1st chat.  I went back and initiated another chat and began communicating with Jamey.  Shortly thereafter, I was not receiving any response from him.  I tried chat again and connected with Griff, who sent me back to Jamey.  At this point, Jamey's and my communication went well.  He was very helpful, despite my frustrations at that point.  He did a good job and I am finally up and running.  Kudo's to Jayme.  Thank you.

title: Honesty vs Profit what a joke
text: Hello all, I have seen this complaint before so I am also writing to protect future Nord buyers.  BEAWARE. If you try the ONE month plan, subscription renewal is set to AUTO. If you don't go to settings and change it (INACTIVE) you will continue to be charged every month. The best part (not) is that NORDvpn won't notify you immediatly after the end of the 30 day period. You will recieve an email with info about your extra charge about 4 months later.  This is how I found out about it. It is not about the money. 50 euros is not the end of the world. But it is definately the end of my relationship with this company. Just be honest tou your clients motherf....ers. Maybe I am asking to much...

title: After 2 yrs, a problem arose
text: I subscribed to NordVPN for a 3-yr period. At just over 2-yrs into it, I had to change modems & routers for my ISP.  I got the best router I could & after installing both modem & router, I could no longer connect.  I spent 1-2 hrs (?) on interactive chat with Blake in tech support, who was wonderful.  But we could not get the issue resolved.  Later in the day, I went to the router's manufacturer's site (tp-link) only to find that my router, the AX6000, does not support the third part NordVPN.  But I did find out that the router has its own built-in VPN, so I enabled that & called NordVPN to cancel my subscription & get a refund for the unused part of my subscription.  Only then did I find out that they will NOT give a refund for any unused subscription.  So I simply went into my account & made sure that auto-renew is turned OFF.  I'll loose 8 months of subscription fees, but that is a small amount ($40-$50). So I warn potential NordVPN customers to their policy (which I did not know about - my fault).  I was happy with Nord while I used it, but taking a 3-yr subscription was asinine.  I highly recommend you take only 1 yr subscriptions at a time because technology changes rapidly & you may find out that your next router doesn't work with NordVPN.  I was told by the billing department that I could use Nord through OpenVPN, but what's the point when the ti-link AX6000 router offers a built-in VPN that encrypts your communications but does not anonymize (which I don't need). I also advise folks to check with Nord BEFORE purchasing a new router to make sure your selected router works.  And do NOT rely on the lists online - call & have tech support check it out for you.  Again, technology changes often & rapidly so better safe than sorry. Finally, I found Blake in tech support to be an outstanding individual - knows his stuff, is patient and courteous.  A good reflectoin on Nord!  And their chat system was the best, most responsive I've ever used - not 5 minutes between comments.  Kudos, Nord!

title: Thank you very much "lee"
text: Thank you very much, Lee. Hello, I am a user of your company. Since your service is already the best, I would like to write a thank you for the service I received from Lee today. I signed up for your service 7 months ago and have signed up for a $100 plan. I was confused because I forgot my ID when I suddenly logged out today because I set up automatic login. Since it was a random email address, I was confused when I couldn't log in with the ID I remembered, and I decided that the ID had been deleted, so I put in an inquiry, and I met Lee. My English is terrible. In addition, it took a long time to find the record because it was already a payment record seven months ago, and I made a mistake and informed him of another payment record, so this would have been an unbearable consultation for Lee. But "lee" encouraged me to stay calm, and remained kind for an hour of counseling. And he finally told me that my ID wasn't deleted, but that I remembered it incorrectly. He helped me find the ID that I almost lost. As you know, Korean is an important customer of vpn companies because the demand for vpn is huge. Through the kind service of "lee", I have become more reliable with your service, and I have plans to continue my subscription next time. In addition, if people around me plan to use vpn, I will recommend your company without hesitation. Once again, thank you for your kind service, Lee, and I wish you endless progress.

title: Every time I get on the computer this…

Frequent updates give bad actors more opportunities to perpetuate malware if the hack the mothership. I don’t know if this is industry standard but I don’t like it. It’s not virus scanning software, it’s a VPN. Build it right and ship it, don’t update it on the daily.

title: Security Concerns with Israeli Servers
text: This is a difficult review to write, but I think I have to share my experience. I am from the USA and over the past 25 years have often traveled to the Middle East, in a large part to pursue human rights activities, notably often on behalf of Palestinians. I have traveled extensively to Israel/Palestine a number of times and have engaged in activist activities and research activies criticizing Israel's treatment of the Palestinians. I know I am known to Israeli security folks because of my past activities. VPNs are critically important in the MIddle East, and previously I had an account with Express VPN. When, however, Kape Technologies of Israel bought Express VPN I thought it prudent to switch, and I chose NordVPN.  I am now back in the MIddle East (not in Israel/Palestine) and turned on my Nord account on my Chromebook. For some reason, the account always took me to the Israeli server - almost never to my chosen server(s) in the USA or elsewhere. If Nord did allow me to connect to a non-Israeli server, almost immediately it would route me back to the Israeli server. I noted this to the support staff at Nord and requested help in avoiding being linked to the Israel server for the reasons stated above. Altough I was told how to set up an "obfuscated" connection (which I did), that did not solve the problem - always kicked back to the Israeli server. Because I need my connection to be secure because of my job, I cannot tolerate even the possibility that my communications are being monitored. I realize that there is no such thing as perfect safety, but to have my communicatins routed through an Israeli server is tantamount to my asking for trouble. I finally asked Nord to block my access to the Israeli server. The response was to send me a list of servers in Turkey that might work. That is not acceptable. Let me be clear: I am not saying that Nord's system has been compromised, because I don't know that for a fact. But I do know for a fact that Israel as a country makes a point of overreaching when it comes to what it considers security issues, and has shown a particular hostility towards things Palestinian. The lack of national business ethics was best exposed in the Pegasus software scandal -- and that attitude really concerns me. Because I sense a risk in dealing with Nord because it could not assure me that I could avoid being connected to Israeli servers, I decided not to use Nord any more (even though I have nine months left on my contract). I am now with a different, smaller VPN company that has yet to try to connect me with an Israeli server and is working quite well.

title: Horrible error handling, decent app, easy interface, helpful support.
text: Well, this review ought to be fun. Nord is a good VPN service, when the app works properly. The interface is extremely easy to use (albeit a bit clunky upon startup) and using the app is so simple a toddler can do it ... again, that is when it works.  I have had authentication errors on several dozen occasions over the last couple weeks alone and was a few moments away from switching over to another VPN service like Express VPN. The authentication error message is absolutely unhelpful and gives no information on what went wrong (EG: an error code to give support). No matter what I did, I could not get Nord VPN to open my browser and authenticate me. So much so, that I was having authentication errors more often than not; hence the reason I was heavily considering switching. And no, it wasn't a credentials issue or anything like that. It's just the app is horrible at authentication and even worse at handling errors. This evening, I contacted support to ensure that I'd crossed all my t's and dotted all my i's, and I am (so far) glad that I did. I started off by speaking with Brad, who was very helpful for the small amount of time we'd interacted. It was a gentleman named Caesar who was most helpful. He walked me through the process to try to fix the issue. He was very professional and very kind. I admit, as nice and attentive as he was, I will be watching Nord VPN closely and if the authentication error happens one more time I will be discontinuing my subscription and switching over to another VPN provider. For now, I have no other complaints. If you plan to use (or already are using) NordVPN and you don't receive any authentication errors as I have, I can promise that you will not be unhappy.

title: Been with NordVPN for maybe 4 years…
text: Been with NordVPN for maybe 4 years now.  Always been able to get help when I need it.  I do wish there was a little better Linux support though.  For the Linux users, a simple desktop indicator, (written by Nordvpn), living on a panel to tell you it's on or off, would be so helpful.  TOR over VPN using NORDLYNX  is flawless and pretty fast too!  Overall, if you want a fast, secure and easy to use VPN service, for a great price, this is the one.  One last comment.  Everyone needs to research the vpn company they use.  Ever ask yourself, "who owns them?  Dig deep.  Also, read an Internet book call "The Hitchhikers Guide to Online Anonimity".  Then, you will understand why I use NordVPN.

title: I bought this service to protect myself…
text: I bought this service to protect myself while streaming online, but it's honestly the worst thing I've downloaded on a PC since limewire. I am constantly having my internet throttled, or even just disconnected and reconnected 30 times a minute. Making playing games, reading chat, watching a YouTube video, streaming Hulu or Netflix, updating, and doing paperwork for my job impossible. I know it is due to the nord app because my phone never had connection problems until I downloaded the VPN for my mobile device. There the app costing me hours of work both professionally and personally. From causing me to lose my updated work hours to hours of video editing. All it takes is turning the VPN on for me to get the "you've gone offline" notification, as soon as I disconnect it I'm magically connected back to the internet. If any of the safe browsing setting are turned on like ad block, I will not be allowed to use any website. I read and tried all the connection solutions nord offers online and even outside help to try and make the service work. I uninstalled the service despite having over a year of it left to use. I've payed to create connection issues and downloaded an app that sits at disconnected on my PC everyday. I recently switched to express VPN over a month ago, and have experienced nothing like what I did with nord. I would not recommend nord to anyone.

title: Recurring issue with iOS
text: I have a problem using NordVPN on my iPad which has continued over many months where the Connection time on the app reverts to 0h0mins00s and freezes there. This carries through to the statistics section and also stops the Weekly time connected from working. After numerous emails and suggested fixes it was admitted - “ We are aware of issues with the iOS with connection time showing differently via the device's settings and our application. Our developers are aware of the issue and are looking into implementing a fix for this.  However, at this time, we would rather not give you an estimation when we do not actually have one for certain.” The only temporary fix is to repeatedly delete and reload the app. While otherwise NordVPN is excellent, the inability to fix a software issue by a company priding itself on internet security is concerning, as was the time expended with the inaptly named ( if prompt and helpful ) Customer Success Team over three weeks implementing their various suggestions to fix the issue when it was not possible to do so. Nor was any compensation for the time wasted offered when requested.

title: Waste of Money
text: It's buggy, a lot of the features are still in beta.  I have to turn off the VPN to interact with many of the sites I frequently use. (can't put anything in shopping cart at Walmart.com, eBay thinks I am in Panama now, even thought I am using VPN servers in the US...)  ...And yes, I have spoken to their helpdesk.....  I have Norton on other PCs, and whereas I am not a big fan of Norton either, I rarely have problems with their VPN.  Sorry guys, I really wanted to like you.  But now I am stuck with you for 2 years.....

title: Difficulty to log in
text: I was having difficulty to log in. The application would not accept my authentication code. So, I contacted Customer service and after many questions, finally got an agent to chat. She/he spent almost 20 minutes to verify my account. Information requested was for date, credit card used and the amount. the amount was not confirmed, and it took more time and hassle for me to dig in previous emails from Nord to confirm that I had an account with Nord. Finally, my MFA was removed, and I could Login. It should not take this much hassle to help cstomers for an international organisation like NORD which claims it to be the best in its class.

title: The best I can say about NordVPN is…
text: The best I can say about NordVPN is that it is less bad than 2 previous VPNs. I would give NordVPN a better grade if they could fix 2 serious issues: 1.  Many financial institutions use a security software called CloudFare.  For a long time, though less often recently, CloudFare would block access through NordVPN, declaring NordVPN servers Insecure or Untrustworthy.  So during sessions with these institutions I had to disconnect from NordVPN, highly undesirable. The problem may be Cloudfare's, but surely we should expect NordVPN to coordinate proactively with all eCommerce security SW providers to Whitelist all NordVPN servers.  Is this really happening?  If yes, NordVPN should say so.  If not, why not? 2. Way too often in a Win10 rebooting, NordVPN makes me go through a NordVPN login.  Sometimes that takes extra time.  Sometimes no such login is required.  Why the unpredictable rebooting experience?  No discernable pattern.

title: The worse experience with VPNs in China is with NORDVPN
text: I must share my experience with using NordVPN in China and save others from not making the same mistake as I did. My platform is Windows, laptop. I must admit it is the worse VPN that you can pay for and being not able to use it for most of the time. Really, I do not know why on the internet are so many adds, reviews about how NordVPN is great, but it is quite opposite they should write how bad actually is. Now, it is 22 months since I bought it and in total, I was not able to use it for around 11 months, imagine it is the half of the time not being able to surf with NordVPN. First time when it happened, I could not use it for a month in row, then second time for 3 months in row, then 4 months in row. Now, for more than last 3 months in row they are still fixing the problem for Windows, and I am not able to use it again. What to add or say, please save your time, nerves, money etc. and never buy NordVPN if you are in China because even that they give it to you for free it is almost useless here. So many frustrations, wasted time, I could write a book about it. Free VPNs are much better than Nord, at least you know sometimes they work and sometimes don`t but you pay for something, and it does not work most of the time. From the customer service you always get the same excuses we are working on a solution and this sentence or few others are circling, repeating for months and months, just copy paste formula. Anyway, on Android that I used rarely, it worked more than on my laptop. In total just never choose NordVPN for China because is useless and it will make you crazy frustrated. For other countries I really do not know. Luckily, I used some other free VPNs that worked during these long periods of time when I was not able to use NordVPN and my friend helped me with giving me her VPN that always works here in China not like Nord. Wish you good luck.

title: Poor Compatibility on Android
text: I wanted a VPN for my mobile phone, but liked that I could install NordVPN on multiple devices.  I installed NordVPN on my PC and on my Samsung Galaxy Fold 3.  On PC, I barely notice that it's there, it just quietly works efficiently and effectively in the background.  On my Android device, I tried it for several months and worked with Nord customer services to try to figure out how to get it working with the other apps installed on my phone.  I found that NordVPN was incompatible with most video streamers, including Netflix, Disney+ and Amazon Prime Video, all of which blocked streaming and downloading while using NordVPN with its default options.  Even YouTube showed signs of incompatibility with NordVPN, though this seemed to be limited to the advertisements between or during videos.  NordVPN customer services instructed me to try disabling some of the advanced features of the VPN (which didn't work), then by forcing specific IP addresses (which didn't work).  In my opinion, disabling the advanced features and forcing specific IP addresses defeats the purpose of me buying the VPN in the first place.  I requested a refund, but was denied due to being over the initial 30-day money back period.  I would have given a one star rating, but gave a second start due to its quiet efficiency on PC.  I have now uninstalled NordVPN from my phone and will not be renewing the subscription for phone or PC - it's just not worth it.  I would advise not to purchase NordVPN if you expect to use the full suite of its functions.

Maybe it works better on a computer  but for a phone it's useless. I wasted $100 on Nord VPN.

Few times a month a current proxy becomes slow, manually choosing the same country helps, it could be automatic, but - it might break some games or create lags at unexpected times, so I prefer manual re-connect with a warning that current proxy experiences overload. All in all, this is a great VPN service, I love to use it.

title: Worse than dialup
text: Worse than dialup: it's not just slow, it requires you to constantly manually reconnect to a new VPN server. Every time you leave wifi. Every time you move from one cell tower to another. Every time you open a different app. After it's been a little while. Sometimes just because. NordVPN will basically make it impossible to use your smartphone, and apps that rely on consistent connection will all fail. Support is not interested in understanding this problem. And they trick you into buying a multi-year policy to save money, before you can figure out how lousy the service is. Avoid!

title: App problems. Irksome Support.
text: I have been using the service for several years with few problems. Unfortunately, in recent weeks, I have been having frustrating and repeated problems with the app freezing that necessitate me having to turn the phone off and on again. Reponses from Support have been generic, unfocussed and (apparently) without intitially reading the text of the report. Since writing the comments above; the phone app has continued to freeze intermittently and I have been instructed to repeat the same "fault finding" actions of clearing caches, re-installing the app (etc), which is not inspiring any confidence that there is any substantive resolve to address this irksome problem. Update to this review. Nord and I have exchanged 36 messages on this ongoing problem now. It still isn't resolved; and I keep being asked to follow largely the same instructions. Further update. Now on (roughly) 67 exchanged messages on this issue and still no further. The annoying problem is that Tech Support keep asking me to repeat the same actions. For example; de-install and then reinstall the same version of the same application.  It is a shame, because for the last few years it has worked without issue.

title: Trouble connecting from China after purchasing
text: First, I gave it 4 stars because my experience with NordVPN started off rocky but not because of the service from Martin. He would get 5 stars in my book. I just bought NordVPN because I have seen it on some influencer pages that I follow. I decided to try it out, but right when I bought it, I couldn't connect. I had to figure out why and soon found out it is because I live in China. I have used Astrill and ExpressVPN for years and have had no problems, so I was already skeptical and a bit worried about my purchase. I contacted the support team and spoke with Martin. He was super helpful with walking me through step by step. I think the process is a bit annoying to be honest because I have to manually connect and type in 50 different servers to try out. I will be moving back to the states soon though, so I am able to have some time there to still check it out during my 30 day trial period. For now, I will mess around and see which server suits me best. I appreciate the help from Martin in the meantime, and hopefully, I can get this working smoothly from now until I leave.

text: I have been a customer of NordVPN for at least 5 years now.  Unfortunately their customer service has radically declined, got too big I guess.  I am unable to access the email address I started the account with and NordVPN staff REFUSE to help me reset the email account despite my PROVING I have paid for the account. I can access the account but am unable to change the email address myself.  NordVPN keep asking for information they have sent to the email address I can't access, knowing FULL WELL I can't access it. They have been messing me around for days asking for various forms of proof (receipts from Paypal payments), and after my providing such, stating they still WON'T help me. And now I want a refund for the recent yearly subscription they took from my account - they are STILL being obstructive. Great VPN service, really crappy customer service. NB: This issue was over an automatic renewal to a 12 month plan I purchased for the FIRST time last year.  They were much friendlier when I was paying month to month, strangely enough. Re: NordVPN response below:  There are NO instructions in the "service ticket".  I have access to the account, have produced receipts of payment, but hey, still not enough...this response is "butt covering".

title: The reason for me getting a VPN was for…
text: The reason for me getting a VPN was for odd emails sent to my Xfinity account which made me very concerned as it dealt with extortion and fraud type of emails. I put a Fraud Alert on my Experian Account and all my credit cards just in case purchases came through. And then I decided to get a VPN. Since I follow Chrome Unboxed, and since I trusted them, I decided to give NordVPN a try. I also changed Internet Providers. The results: almost no odd emails except for two which I didn't even open as I can now identify them. Absolutely none have come through my gmail account. I am one very satisfied customer.

title: A small bug that’s NOT just a Nord problem but a VNP problem.
text: Great App, that I only just remembered I’m  was paying for. It works the way it’s supposed to & have even managed to watch tv programs not available in our country using Nord. The only thing that I sometimes get a problem with is, it stops my phone from working. When it 1st happened, I thought my phone was broken but remembered my son had exactly the same problem with a different but ‘free’ VPN that happened a hell of a lot more often than Nord. My husband eventually made him delete, thinking it wasn’t safe. It’s very rare for it to happen with Nord but when it does Safari, games, anything Wi-Fi related doesn’t work. I turn the NordVPN off & everything starts working straight away & can turn the VPN back on without any problems. I know this isn’t just a Nord problem, it must be a VPN problem. Nord has given me loads of perks that I’m very thankful for BUT I’m tech illiterate & made a mess with the Nord password protection as I already use Apple keychain. I know I’ve been given more perks but haven’t looked into them properly yet, I’m sorry. I’ve given Nord 5 stars because Nord is a great App, I don’t have to do anything except pick a location & everything else is done for me.  I can’t blame Nord for a bug that I know has happened to other VPN’s.  Thank you to whoever has to read this (🤞 you’re not a bot)I’m sorry for such a long message. I hope you’re having a great day & please take care x

title: Choose someone else.
text: Their service is okay, probably the same as anyone's, but their customer service is horrible and their app is a joke.  They don't code their own but rather use MS code so if you don't have an updated machine you're on your own to configure the VPN settings which aren't for the faint of heart.  I've had broken adapter settings for a month thanks to Nord's suggestion of using OpenVPN.  I really wish I had went with someone else. Update:  One person's complaint isn't going to fix your app built on MS subroutines that aren't available on older systems.  If you do manage to solve my problem that isn't going to change the fact that your customer service is horrible.  Also note worthy is that you run a reddit board that you won't let a lot of people post to, which further shows you don't care about good customer service.

title: NordVPN great support and functionality
text: NordVPN in in a class of its own in terms of functionality, speed, ease of use, and customer support. It has worked flawlessly on both of our iPhones, desktop computer workstation, and is even available as an option to install on Smart TV's!! Our LG Smarty TV is using Chromecast with Google TV and NordVPN is running whenever the TV is on. Recently, I was having an issue logging into a URL from our computer and was getting "Access Denied" errors while NordVPN was running but not with other websites. NordVPN support (Manson) quickly diagnosed the issue and assisted me with correcting DNS entries by creating a Custom DNS within NordVPN and PRESTO! All is well. Great product which delivers as advertised.

title: Had problems logging into NordVPN
text: Had problems logging into NordVPN. NordVPN would not go past the login page on the app even after a successful login. Spent hours troubleshooting by myself to no avail. Then tried their chatbot which just sent me in circles. When I finally managed to jump through enough hoops to talk to an actual person, Ezekiel was able to determine that my software was out of date and gave me the download link for the new version. Kudos to Ezekiel who managed to remain patient and polite in the face of my frustration and anger, but the NordVPN app is a huge problem in its current design. Why is there no way to update the software without getting past the login page? Why are there no options to update on the login page itself? I can't update the app without logging in, but I can't log in without first updating the app... Seriously? Furthermore, the chatbot experience, as in ALL chatbot experiences on the web, is terrible. NordVPN should be glad that their bad design and chatbot architecture was saved by a single good and helpful employee...

title: It's Gotten Better!
text: I've been with NordVPN for roughly a year now, and while my first few months with them were rocky, things have smoothed out significantly during the past 3-4 months. In fact, now, when I use NordVPN, the connections come up right away and remain solid for pretty much as long as the workstation or computer is powered on. This is with both Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS and Windows 10 and 11. Nicely done, NordVPN! ======================================== My previous review from May of 2022 follows. ======================================== Meh. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes when connecting to a VPN, there is no internet connectivity, and sometimes there is. Sometimes when there is connectivity, it goes away after a few minutes or hours without any intervention and I have to connect again. I have contacted NordVPN about this multiple times, and have been asked to jump through hoop after hoop, taking my time to help debug a paid product, with implications that it’s something in my specific environment. Yet I’m running vanilla Windows 10 and Vanilla Ubuntu 20.04. LTS

title: What you need to know about NordVPN support as a Linux user...
text: The other day I was trying to connect to my NordVPN account on my Linux system. The connection instead of flat out failing, simply froze in a loop of trying to connect. As a content creator I depend on NordVPN for my privacy. So by this point I am starting to get worried, my stream could be delayed because of this. After trying everything I could think to do, I went to NordVPN for help. The first support agent I worked with was Larry. At first I did not know what to expect. But as Larry worked I was beyond impressed, I thought to myself, man they actually hired an expert for this job! Eventually I needed to reset my system for support reasons, so I lost contact with Larry. The next expert I dealt with was Ezekiel. Ezekiel continued where I left off with Larry, and soon my situation was solved. I was actually amazed, going into this I did not expect the level of support I received. Both Larry and Ezekiel were polite, patient, and knowledgable. 5 star support in my experience. In writing this review, I initially had forgotten Larry's name. I thought I would miss the change to mention him. But then, I went back to support and worked with Luna. I asked if about the names of the representatives I spoke with recently, and her response was just what I needed. AGENT (Luna): As I can see you chatted with Ezekiel and Larry. :)  My entire support experience was a pleasure. Something that I find rare in my general experience... If you use Linux, do not hesitate to use NordVPN as your VPN of choice!

title: Doesnt work in restricted countries. No refund provided
text: I've paid for a full year of VPN and password storage. Have been using the service for like 2-3 months. There have always been some issues. You would need to constantly contact support to get the working servers. Recently even that stopped working. Asking to support the issue the response is "developers are working on it". Hence a downloaded proton free version and it works. FREE VERSION WORKS while Nord refuses to give a refund for the service that isn't working. UPD: The service isn't working for more than 2 weeks now. Asking for the refund you get educated about their terms and NO refund is given. DO NOT PAY for the whole year. If you decide to risk and go with nord at least save yourself some money and pay only on monthly basis. THEY WILL NOT GIVE A REFUND EVEN IF THE SERVICE IS NOT WORKING.

title: Be very careful with auto renew
text: I recently subscribed for what I thought was a fixed one month only subscription not realising it was on an auto renewal basis until I cancelled. After using for a week or so after subscribing I didn't use the service at all for the remainder of my month. Around 2 days after auto renewal I realised that my credit card had been charged for another month. I immediately contacted NordVPN customer services explaining the situation and requesting a refund in the interests of customer goodwill but, unlike other service providers who also have an auto renewal policy, they were completely unwilling to refund. I checked the sign-in process again and the auto-renewal language was in very small font and at the very end of the sign-up process, so extremely easy to miss. Based on this experience would not use NordVPN or recommend it further, which is unfortunate as the service itself was reasonable but not super reliable and there are plenty of highly-rated competitors in the space who I would rather consider next time around.

title: Nord VPN Review
text: Re ease of use, installing updates etc. everything has been trouble free and easy to do and according to reviews Nord VPN has consistently rated at or near the top and with their use of RAM to power their servers so that data can't be stored I can't see any reason to not give Nord 5 stars. They have also apparently been independently audited multiple times at their request and come out well (according to some reviews) so I am as sure as I can be given that I don't have inside access or the skills to find anything untoward. That leaves us in the situation that if you want a VPN you have to trust someone and I can't think of any option that is better value for money or safer.

The few issues I faced happened because some sites don't work well when you're connected to a VPN but you usually find a way around it. The only thing I regret is that NordVPN is advertised for watching shows unavailable in your coutry, which is possible but limited for example with Netflix. The platform detects pretty easily your VPN connection and blocks you. Another important thing is that many shows (especially anime) are not dubbed nor subtitled in english so if you're not a native speaking Japanese for example, it's apmost no use to use the Japanese Netflix! After the year or so that I spent using NordVPN, I would say it's worth using especially for the price you pay with their many offers!

title: Unreliable service
text: The pros: The service does actually work, and as far as I can tell keeps your data private and your location secret. I can watch Netflix for any region whenever I want, and all the other usual things you would do with a VPN. The cons: Their service is so absurdly unreliable that I almost never use it. Their biggest use case they advertise, protecting all of your traffic all of the time, is completely impossible, because they can never maintain a reliable connection. It worked right up until their "money back" window expired, at which point I couldn't use it for more than an hour before it started persistently dropping the connection and became unusable. I tried contacting their support department, but all they could provide were bandaid fixes that never actually worked for any length of time. I have no ill will towards them, and their service does work for short term browsing, but they've got a long way to go before I'm happy with them.

title: One year of unknowingly paying…
text: Worst costumer-support experience. After one year of unknowingly paying for their service I receive an email with a receipt of the most recent month renewal. I was at this time completely unaware of any subscriptions. I am sure I tried to end my subscription, when I first signed up, but for some reason it did not go through. I am a tech geeky person, so I can confirm that their option to unsubscribe really sucked back then. (seems they changed it now, but with no care for anyone that got stuck with it) I then contact their support (bot) and get redirected to a live-chat with staff. They then tell me that they are not obligated to inform me of my purchases, however they recently changed their policy so they now send monthly emails. I haven't been using their product once since the initial month. I then ask to at least get my 30-day money-back guarantee, however I'm informed that applies to the initial purchase only. And since it's been so long time ago they wont do anything. While it might be technically legal, it's a super shady business model to get people to sign up and hope they get stuck. There has been no willingness to return any money or compensate me in any way. I can confirm what many others here have experienced and warn you to keep away from this company. text: I bought the NordVPN to watch the NCAA final four weekend on my Xbox one. My console only would allow me to use the VPN service only through a PC which I did not own. I had a VPN on my phone already provided by my wireless carrier so I couldn't use NordVPN and ask for a refund the very next day. They followed up with a very nice and respectful email asking me to explore any and all of my devices but sadly I did not and after the trial period ended they sadly but respectfully refunded my purchase price. During that trial period they offered many options and suggestions to keep my subscription active and seeing their commitment to satisfy a new customer really made me wish I had more devices on hand just to keep my account active because I knew they were committed to providing good service and honest feedback. Usually an internet company won't honor a "money back guarantee"; but NordVPN does, and did for me. If there service is as half as good as their integrity is, then NordVPN must be the best VPN on the net. Sincerely,  John from Rock Hill, S.C.

title: Switched from Norton!
text: Read reviews of various VPNs (too many "issues" with my Norton VPN, which I've used for YEARS, so wanted to switch).  NordVPN looked pretty good.  Have had it running now on a MacBook Pro and an iPhone XR and a non-brand-name PC and even on my Samsung Tab A, for a few months with ZERO problems! I love the kill-switch option.  If, for whatever reason, the VPN becomes unavailable, this OPTION automatically kills access to the Internet.  Another thing I love is the automatic "launch with start-up."   Oh, here's another - I can set WHERE I want to appear to be.  I occasionally visit sites in Europe and speak German & French so I can choose one of the NordVPN servers in Europe and things run very smoothly.  If I ever have occasion to pause the VPN (some sites won't allow a connection with it - I normally avoid these but sometimes...), I can pause for a short or longer time or, of course, just turn it off.  Connecting again is easy - simply unpause OR, if completely disconnected, hit the "Quick Connect" and I'm instantly back under NordVPN.  Yeah... I like this program!

title: I have been using NordVPN for a little…
text: I have been using NordVPN for a little over a year. Overall, it does what a VPN should. It protects and is easy to use for beginners. I have used it for both Windows and Linux. On my computers, tablet and phone. All easy to set up and all easy to run. A word on Linux, because there are so many Distros, it could be a little much for someone who only uses GUI on Linux. You may have to use the Terminal window to run and activate/deactivate. If you're comfortable with that, then it works great. Also, as with some other VPN, you may have to deactivate it to get to some of your financial sites or bill paying sites. This has happened maybe 3% of the time for me. The simple timer option allows to stop it for a period of time you need and automatically will connect when the time is up. This has helped a lot. I have not had the need to use some of the additional features, but I can say that if they work as well as the main program, then it would be a great VPN for others. There have been smaller issues over time, but nothing that couldn't be fixed after searching the problem online.

title: Pricing is very confusing/misleading
text: Pricing is very confusing/misleading if you are an Australian customer. Although there is no mention that the price shown is in USD, and that there is a note stating: "Payments are charged in AUD. Payment provider fees may apply. Plan automatically renews until cancelled.", the fact is that your credit card will be charged in AUD, but the actual price shown is in USD. To me this seems like a bit of a fraud. So my $86.86 transaction really turned out to be a $120.38 transaction. Honestly, I probably would have been happy paying the $120, but to be deceived like this makes you feel like the whole operation is dodgy.

title: Funny story
text: Funny story, j/k Recently (2018 to present), every cell phone I have owned has either grew feet and walked away or jumped out of my hands at some point and cracked the screen or camera lens. Sometimes both.   Every time I replaced these phones and began downloading and opening apps on my new phone, I got derailed by security question after security question just to end up being asked for the 2-Factor Authenticator (2FA) code linked to my authenticator, for the app I am trying to access.  Every time this has happened I immediately regret setting up an Authenticator and 2FA or MFA for an app. It's another mountain to climb in the adventure of accessing our digital lives through new technology when equipment and software are updated. With a damaged screen, it makes the process feel like an impossible feat.  I was really frustrated this last time but then I saw a chat bubble at the bottom right of my browser screen light up red. I begrudgingly clicked on it, fighting off the urge to figure this out on my own again.  The CSR/Tech that I was connected with walked me through the process and instantaneously, the growing wave of anxiety was subdued by the out going calmness that is realized through the sense of security.

If I hadn't just happened to check another item in the hidden icons I would have never known. Not sure why their system does this, but it's a major major security flaw. If I could give less than one star that's what I would leave. A security system is absolutely and completely worthless if you can't rely on it 100% to NOT just log you out and leave you exposed on a whim.

title: Would recommend at a good price.
text: I've used NordVPN for over 3 years now - the service works mostly well, but sometimes it takes ages to connect to a server. However for the most part it works well. My subscription was ending this month and my saved card had expired, so I thought if I did nothing the subscription would just end and I wouldn't be charged, however I was charged (I was told this was a normal process for recurring prices).  I spoke to the customer service rep Anya using live chat who was actually very helpful, she apologised for the unexpected charge, but explained to me that's how the recurring price charge worked. I was skeptical, but she offered me a full refund or an additional 18 months of service, because I had been such a long standing customer. I was sold, so I guess I'll be a customer for another couple of years now.

title: Great customer service experience
text: Due to a power outage, I lost my ongoing connection with one of the NordVPN servers, and I could not reconnect no matter what I've tried. Consequently, I contacted the customer service, and after some time wasted with a robot (who the heck invented these useless computerized answers?) I had the pleasure to chatting with a human being - Brad. Through due diligence, and with Brad's help, I finally got back in the game - I am again connected to a NordVPN server. I want to specifically mention Brad's name because I'm not using the run-of-the-mill Window$, but I'm a Linux user. It takes more technical knowledge to troubleshoot a Linux networking problem than it is required for a M$ Window$. Brad delivered, and I am grateful for his help. Great experience and with a positive result! Kudos to NordVPN's customer service.

Please be aware of the caveat around the refund policy, I would very much like to see it changed to not be so anti-consumer.

title: Ive used u for yrs now and i enjoy ur…
text: Ive used u for yrs now and i enjoy ur speeds and service so far but my time has come to an end now as i no longer trust ur service and i will look for another instead at least for now. My problem, and it should be everyones who care about their privacy, is that sometimes when i switch computers or it logs itself out, i get the startup box which wants a login to open the protocol to then enter the program itself. Because u cant even open and enter the program itself without this uhh?!? I use a kill switch obviously. I cant open the protocol without turning it off to login. the problem then is that it will ONLY open this protocol to enter and login on my default browser, i cannot choose ffs. I do NOT want to open my normal browser without a vpn on so all my tabs, history etc is then xposed, i mean w.t.f? I want to CHOOSE the browser, like tor in my case or any other, that doesnt have my stuff loaded for my provider and kill bates to see. This is the whole point of using a vpn no? I have tried to log in manually via tor , there is no dl option for the protocol that way, and reinstalling the program still force me to that damn startup page which will then ONLY let me login in via my default browser(tor cant be set to default) which then completely xposes everything i have open etc. This absolutely infuriates me and its a major flaw in ur design. You are taking away OUR choice to enter settings and the program itself just for this silly thing. Its a huge safety flaw and I no longer trust u tbh.  How hard is it to add a dl protocol link on a manual login or something like that?!? It defies ur whole purpose with this sheet come on. Also, what happened to ur front site, many small changes that just makes it worse and clunky now.  Its too hard to search for things. It keeps u logged in when i dont want it to and its set to not remember pw etc. Searching for the Linux command codes is near imposible, i always end up having to find them via a google search lol. Linux autoconnection guide is difficult to follow also because it says it varies from distro to distro and it uses this example. Ok then where is the example i need for my distro. Small things like this recently ive noticed, ur integrity has fallen, specially with this fecking login protocol thing that xposes ur privacy. You also basically steal money in a sneaky way. On autorenewal sometimes if there is no money on my account when its time to renew it will send u a mail saying it will keep trying for A FEW MORE DAYS. This is a LIE. It will keep trying for weeks ffs w.t.f? Sometimes I do NOT want to spend money on the vpn the the rest of that month for economic reasons and then I xpect it will stop trying to renew after those few days. Then i will put in money on my account to use for soemthing else, and in my case over a week later you just stole them and autorenewed. LOL? Change ur description to 'we will keep trying forever untill u cancel autorenewal' then, dont fecking lie? Ive really noticed a lot of these small details thats comes close to having more focus on commercial and cash grab than actual integrity and user control. And how hard is it to add a nordcpn button to home site once ur in account settings instead on ur webpage? Why do i have to go to search engine to type nordvpn to get bk to the start to see this or that, when it should be easy to do once ur in. Another small anoying detail! And i find is highly concerning u have added a google and appl connect link to ur page in account, its almost like u dont know who they are and why we use a vpn in the first place. Maybe ill return if wireguard etc prove to be worse, but i will cancel my sub for now.

title: I'm never sure whether the program is…
text: I'm never sure whether the program is working properly or working at all. There are no indications that potentially nefarious actors have been identified and/or blocked.   On some of my devices I get a "you are protected" message. Others just say I'm "auto connected."  My VPN connection is usually Denver, CO but I get messages indicating that I've signed into  a site from California, for example . Auto connect doesn't work with Bitdefender on my PC, but works fine on my wife's. The few times I've asked for assistance it was hard to get a simple answer.  There are some included Nord services I've not used because it's not clear to me what the potential side effects might be, i.e slower internet speed, etc.

title: I've been happy with NORDvpn for the…
text: I've been happy with NORDvpn for the three years that I've been using it. Generally, it has worked, glitch-free as I've been traveling to different countries and using the VPN as needed. However, I am disappointed that it seems, as they've got you - a "valued customer" then the rates for usage have gone up rather drastically. I have written to ask why this is - and of course, there's no good reason other than to make more money. If a service can be offered for three years at a reasonable price, then surely a customer signing on again doesn't cause more issues for NORD or cost them any more to maintain the service, so WHY does the price go up so much. It leads me (and I'm sure others) to look for alternatives instead of sitting back and feeling that good old comfort of being served at a reasonable price for a good product. Now I feel as though I need to look elsewhere. Good service but now I feel a little exploited.

title: I had the pleasure to work with Violet
text: I had the pleasure to work with Violet.  She quickly understood my problem that I explained to her. She requested my router log file and a screen shot of the router settings provided page.  She asked me to allow her a few minutes to review.  She came back with the cause of the issue.  The server config file I was using went to a Nord server that inop.  I asked her if she could provide configure file for a Dallas server and with in a minute she posted both top and up files.  I loaded the top file and got the green check mark that I've been looking for.  Way to go Violet you're a Rock Star! When searching for server configuration files in the US. It would be nice to be able to drill down to city of choice. I also noticed that the help for Asus router VPN client is out of date.  I tried to follow it but right start it was not accurate and I ended having to swag it to make the configuration work.  But when one loads a bad configuration file it gets frustrating.  Violet made it all good again. Thank you very much. Ryan Greenup

As an computer engineer, I have tried multiple VPN services and from last three years, I am with NordVPN. They are simply the best among other competitors, because of their overall coverage around multiple countries.  With some help from their engineer, I was able to flash my router to have online security for entire house. I will advise every internet user to use a VPN and will highly recommend using NordVPN.

title: Just discovered that my location was exposed for 5.5 years!
text: I've been with Nord for 5.5 years, and have always been extremely happy with the service. I chose it because it officially supported the openvpn client, provided many servers in many countries, it was honest, trustworthy, reliable, competent, and had a "no logs" policy. That all changed recently when I realised (and proved) that they had added advice to their configuration documentation since I joined that tells customers to disable ipv6, but didn't inform me about it. When I tested for leaks, I was shocked to find that my location was exposed for all those years, completely undermining the reason that I had subscribed to the service. The idea that every single customer who uses openvpn should disable important core functionality just for the relatively small amount of time connected to Nord, just because Nord can't cope, is ridiculous. It's prone to customers missing it, even if they were informed by the docs. It's a sledgehammer of a workaround; a bit like improving the safety of a car that has faulty brakes by removing the engine.  When I contacted support, the advice was that, if I wanted to keep ipv6 enabled, I should use their 4 (out of 5500!) servers that support ipv6. That's a minuscule fraction of the service I pay for. To maintain my service, apparently, I'd have to contact support periodically to find out if the number of ipv6 servers had increased, or if the existing ones have been decommissioned. This would clearly create a really poor customer experience. I offered a range of possible solutions that would improve the situation and increase customer safety but, after 2 weeks / 30 emails, I haven't received a single message that shows they understand my issues (not strictly only the ipv6 issue), and they haven't been interested in how I would be satisfied going forward. I've asked politely countless times that my case be escalated to a senior manager who has the authority to make changes to their approach, but they refuse, but also fail to make any progress whatsoever. If they reply to this review here, then it just proves how little they care about their customers' perspective, because I obviously can't respond. One of my main issues now is that they refuse to have a constructive, productive conversation where my views are acknowledged, or ideas considered. I can't recall a time when I've felt more mislead or let down by a company.

text: Bought in for a 2year low price commitment. The auto connect evidently has problems. I would say 4 out of every seven days I must go reconnect. Sometimes more than once a day. Nothing ever happens if I hit update. So guess what.. I ignore it like every other human does. I believe I am paying about all I would ever pay at my current price point for this somewhat unreliable connection. If I am offered the same deal in another 14 months I most likely will stay with nord. If not.....fill in the blank here________ two letters maximum! After I post this review Nord will automatically create a Trustpiolt account for me. If I wanted a Trustpiolt account I would get one. I will uninstall this. Personally I hate this type of unwanted promotion using what I presumed to be my private sensitive information from a company that proclaims to keep my internet usage free from unwanted eyes.

title: Jeff from NordLocker - please give this man employee of the year.
text: Hi! I spoke with Jeff from NordVPN's Customer Success team today, regarding adding a NordLocker plan to the NordVPN and NordPass Premium 2 year bundle. It was one of my best customer service experiences to date, with any company. This whole world of VPN and all the associated terminology is new to me, and Jeff was incredibly patient and I came out of our chat with a much better understanding of what this is all about.  I highlight the following because Jeff went above and beyond. There were 2 very specific questions that had to do with outside companies/cloud storage that weren’t answered. Jeff immediately assured me someone would reach out to me with more detailed information about those topics. I mention the two unanswered questions because in and of itself, his handling of the situation is one of the reasons why this was such an excellent encounter with a member of the Customer Success team. In between and after those questions, Jeff was incredibly attentive and ensured that he a) answered every single one of my questions with care, b) forwarded my questions to the appropriate departments, c) stayed with me for the remainder of my questions and helped me better understand what I’m dealing with, and d) offered excellent resources for me to review so I can be better informed moving forward. Jeff also sent me a link to the NordLocker premium plan page, where I was able to see a breakdown of the different NordLocker storage tiers/pricing, which is a great start so I am able to be better informed when I am contacted by email from someone else within the NordVPN/Pass/Locker community.   He also made sure to ask if I had any other questions before we ended the chat. NordVPN, NordLocker - what an INCREDIBLE employee you have with Jeff. I’ve been in customer service/customer care for over 10 years as both a representative/agent, and management within such departments, and wow! He deserves the very best and I hope NordLocker knows how lucky they are to have Jeff as a part of their Customer Care team. (FYI, I read the reviewers guidelines and I made sure to have a copy of our chat emailed to me, if for some reason any of this needs verification)

"Unfortunately, we will not be able to refund your payment as our 30-day money-back guarantee applies to the initial purchase only. This period is for customers to evaluate the features of our product risk-free. After a subscription period of 1 month, 6 months, or 1 year, we would assume that the customer knows our features, uses the product, and agrees to our ToS." When asked how auto renewal was enabled he again pointed to the same terms. Customer person wouldn't say his name and just asked him to refer him as adam " I would not be able to disclose such information for security reasons, unfortunately."  I will say please have an attorney to read all there terms and be away from this service as they charge you for what you aren't using.

text: I have been using Nord VPN for several months before suddenly it stopped working correctly. I was unable to connect to the servers (always stuck at “Assigning IP” step during connection no matter what country or protocol I chose). Support team was very fast and helpful and provided the list of specific servers to try. They worked for a while but then the same issue happened. I contacted support team and they gave me a new list, then again and again. Although the restrictions seem to be on the ISP end, it is not convenient to write to support team every time the issue happens and wait for the reply.  As for  the time when it worked alright, I could not complain about the speed of the connection and the access to the content I could not get without VPN. Still, I wish the Nord VPN team good luck and hope that for the rest of your community the experience will be more pleasant.

title: Can't wait for my subscription to end
text: 1) No more SOCKS proxies, which was the reason why I picked them 2) They sabotage old versions on purpose: while the old versions still technically work (due to a bug in the old version killswitch, I was able to use an old version for a short while while it was supposed to be disabled), they pretend they don't. You're not my mommy, let me use old versions if I choose to do so 3) New versions are worse and worse. In particular, they removed the integrated login: now you need to use your browser, ie you need to let your browser connect to the internet without the VPN being active. Stellar security!!!!! 4) They don't provide an offline installer anymore It's like they have some staff dedicated to inventing ways to make the product worse! Every single "improvement" they make make their software worse :x I took a very long subscription because of the discount. Won't renew it.

title: Very Happy with Nord VPN
text: Overall, we have been very happy with Nord VPN for the past year or so. For the most part, it works silently in the background. Only reason not to give it 5 stars is having vpn enabled sometimes slows down browsing - download speeds are reduced by servers in the VPN network. If I turn VPN off, internet speed is back to normal. Sometimes just pausing VPN and re-connecting to a different server is enough to restore normal (fast) internet download speeds.

If you could tie the re-auth behavior to someone’s already payed time period would be extremely cool, as that’s one of the reasons I payed for such long subscription so that I don’t have to worry if the service is logging out in the middle of a banking session leaving my data unprotected.

title: NordVPN disabled my PCs communications and limited web access
text: With NordVPN installed my e-mail service provider would no longer accept my login and a website became inaccessible. A very long time with the help desk took me deeper and deeper into changing settings in a vain attempt to remedy the failures, this resulted in my becoming concerned that my PC would be irrevocably changed for the worse. At the same time the website was simply accessed from a laptop not running NordVPN and e-mail sending restored as soon as I uninstalled NordVPN. A refund was requested after a wasted evening trying to get my PC to do what it had always done well. By way of a reply NordVPN asked for a "Ticket id", I have no ticket id and when I used NordVPNs help desk for more info on "Ticket id" it suggested "How to Create a new Apple ID .."  This was similar to my problems last evening where the third person to try and help me gave instructions to carry out changes which did not relate to options available to me, it became very frustrating and eventually I realised it would not be possible to get NordVPN to work on my PC without losing basic functionality in the process. If NordVPN wish to help please give me your contact details. Thank you.

title: The app does not work on Android 12.
text: The app does not work on Android 12. I bought NordVPN 3 months ago. It worked 'so-so' on my laptop and phone - basically ok, but sometimes i've had issues with connectivity. 3 months after the purchase it suddenly stopped working without any reason - on all my devices. I contacted the support team via chat - despite the supporters try their best - it's a shame that there's no possibility to contact via phone/skype/teams nowadays to discuss more complex issue like I had. It turned out that there was something "wrong with my account. The app would not connect to any server on any device. The windows issue was fixed after 2 days since submitting it. The phone - still unresolved - and won't be, as the support team simply does not know when the Android 12 update will fix it - basically the app does not react on tapping log in/sign in buttons - the internet browser does not appear, so i cannot enter my credentials. This means I cannot use the app at all (over 2 weeks now), I am not entitled to any refund due to the policy - which is disappointing - why I have to pay for a software I cannot use? Android has been available for many weeks already and the app should be prepared and ready for it. I won't recommend the app to anyone in our company, we were thinking of extending the services to the password manager too, but now we do not want to risk a situation, it would suddenly stop working on certain software. Edit: there's no ticket ID as I contacted your support team via chat (at least I have not received anything to my mail). Spoke with Leonard and one of his colleagues later on, on 19th Apr

title: NordVPN and Microsoft's Outlook.
text: I have used Nord products for some time. The application for NordVPN is still a problem for me. I have been working with the support group for several months now, and I believe they have given up on me.  The problem is when you connect with NordVPN. The connection removes any IMAP passwords from Microsoft Outlook, and Therefor I cannot receive or send any mail while NordVPN is connected. I have to enter them whenever I disconnect from NordVPN. It has been a trial And error Process with The support group over several months with several ticket numbers open. With this in mind, I believe the product NordVPN is not a Stable a product for those using Microsoft Outlook.

title: I have two problems with their business…
text: I have two problems with their business practices. 1) i went to their FAQ and looked to see if you could choose your own state. Of course the answer was yes "and often within your city limits". After I subscribed and followed instructions to choose my state, I see they only have 14 servers in the entire United States. If they were sincere, they would just say "our servers are limited" or provide a list right there. Went to live chat and the rep was rude and unhelpful, actually tried to blame me. When subscribing I only wanted a year to try it out. They had a "special" for a two year subscription. I decided just to do it, as I thought I may like the service and would save in the long run. I clicked to purchase and saw that the total was an additional $59.76 (after it processed). I was horrified. They added a two year subscription to Nordpass to store passwords. I then cleared my browser and went back in to see how they duped me. So the Nordvpn subscription is at the top of the page (with button to purchase). This extra subscription they added you would have needed to scroll down past other things, to the very bottom of the page to see it. it says "recommended" then this "Nordpass" subscription and THEY AUTOCHECKED it. Not only that, they subscribed me for two years. In short, they SCAM you.  I will give them a day or two to answer my ticket, and then I will report them to my credit card

title: NordVPN 2 year subscription won't issue a refund
text: I bought NordVPN for 2 years from Russia. It turned out that it doesn't work properly from Russia and I could not use it at all. Then sanctions happened and my card was blocked from international purchases. I do not support the war and I decided to leave Russia.  When I requested a refund customer support first told me that because of the sanctions I can't get a refund to the card that I paid with. They offered me to refund to a bitcoin wallet. But after they told me that they won't refund to bitcoin wallet too. So basically I just lost 100$ for nothing - NordVPN won't issue a refund to my other card or a bitcoin wallet and NordVPN still functions very poorly in Russia Advise to others - don't buy a 2 year subscription before testing a tool for a short period of time.  I really thought that such a big company as NordVPN could issue a refund especially since they can see that I didn't used there service successfully even once.

title: Poor customer service
text: Had a 3 year contract withthem thats worked flawlessly, no problem since I came to renew. I'd stopped the auto renew, and my credit card had expired, so I had to set up the new card details. Then I had to turn on the auto renew. Then I found I'd been billed twice. Got onto the chat and seemed to get a refund sorted. The following day I noticed I'd been charged again, and my contract expires in 6 years! Not what I wanted!! Been trying to log into their chat for 3 hours, and no one available.  Raised another ticket, and hope I can get this resolved. Update: Did get a swift response from Facebook messenger, assured me they'd arrange a second refund and cancelled the auto renew. 40 min later still no change in the website billing info; I'll see what happens tomorrow. Update: 3 debits and exchange fees take, and finally 2 have been refunded with the fees.  Seems the best way to get a result is via Facebook Messenger!

title: I originally purchased NordVPN as a consumer
text: I originally purchased NordVPN as a promotion, 30 months for approx $86. Imagine my surprise when I was informed last week that it was renewed for 1 year at $100. That's a 300% mark up.  It is time to look for an alternative product. Postscript to my original review. I did receive a timely reply from NordVPN (within 6 minutes of my original review above.) They stated that the 300% markup was due to increased costs, that promotional prices are given to new customers only, and to paraphrase "I should suck it up." Their response was not at all helpful.

title: Great Service! - Now getting a 3500% increase in NORD VPN SPEEDS
text: Great Service- I contacted Support VIA Facebook messenger and I must admit I was more than a little upset due to my poor performance speed with the NORD VPN service.  They pointed me in the right direction as I had set it up in my Ubiquiti router and it was only performing at 19Mpbs where as my actual connection speed was just short of 1Tbps.  It appears that most SOHO (Small office/Home Office) routers only have 32Bit (X86) CPU's installed and this limits the ability for applications to use the multi threading capability's that 64bit CPU's offer. This limited my speed drastically. After many hours of research, I hand built my own high performance router with some old PC parts and an I5 8 core CPU using OPN-Sense (opensource) routing software built on the good old trusted FreeBSD (Unix Derivative) software. This ended up giving me with NORD VPN enabled and configured... 500Mbps, which is a 3500% increase in performance. I am absolutely BUZZED and it has never dropped a session to date!

title: Good way to keep from being tracked
text: Good way to keep from being tracked. It can be paused short-term if you need to get to a site that the VPN won’t allow. Takes some getting used to. For example, many of the ads and sponsored items on Google searches and Amazon can’t be accessed with VPN on. Just pause it for 5 min (or longer) and it will resume by itself if you don’t remember to resume it. Love how I pay once and it covers several devices. We have it on our phones and laptop. I would recommend it for security.

title: Satisfied, and recommended.
text: I have had NordVPN for over 3 years now, and have been very satisfied with it. Although it's not at seamless as having no VPN on at all when it comes to loading web pages or downloading things, no VPN is, though to it's credit the throughput speeds are still very high, only losing maybe ~10% overall download speed. The servers connect quickly, and the flexibility with the phone app and otherwise are nice features. They didn't have any NordPass or anything like that when I initially purchased it, and although I wouldn't pay the extra to get it now, I still think it's very important to offer, and I would use it if it were included in the price. Overall, I highly recommend Nord to those looking for a reliable and easy to use VPN.
