title: Does NOT work in China despite what they tell you
text: If you are a windows user, Nordvpn hasn't been working in China since 2020. I've contacted support multiple times, no luck, and they kept coming up with excuses for a solution. After almost a year of no service, I sent support an email in 2021 asking for refund since my subscription is till 2026. Here is the response: Mar 20, 2021, 2:12 GMT+2 Hello, We are contacting you regaring your recent chat with one of our customer success agents. As we can see, your payment has passed our 30 days refund policy and we are unable to make partial refunds of the service. Please take a look at our Terms of Service, which you have agreed upon making the purchase. Nevertheless, we are here to help you with the further use of NordVPN. Please provide us with the NordVPN diagnostics. You can find instructions to extract diagnostics on various Operating Systems here: [ the Iink is deleted as TrustPilot does not allow links in review] Looking forward to your response. Best Regards, Ambrosio Pedrosa Customer Success Team NordVPN.com It's been almost two years now. They just kept your money and no refund. I contacted the support today, April 15 2022. Here is selection of the chat history: AGENT (Mason): Hey!  AGENT (Mason):   USER: could you please send the latest connection method for China users?  AGENT (Mason): What device are you using?  USER: windows  AGENT (Mason): We are currently experiencing some issues with the Windows application, but are already working on new servers to help our customers connecting from China. Unfortunately, now we do not have an estimated time on how long will it take to resolve this issue. Any updates will be posted here: [ the Iink is deleted as TrustPilot does not allow links in review] We apologize for the inconvenience and your patience is greatly appreciated.  USER: there have been two years since I was unable to connect via Nord  AGENT (Mason): I apologize for the inconvenienc,  AGENT (Mason): Inconvenience.*  USER: what is the difference between fraud and what Nord is doing?  AGENT (Manfred): At the moment there is not much we can do regarding the Windows app.  USER: two years   USER: that is not what you had advertised when I signed up  USER: do feel like a fraud to me  AGENT (Manfred): Give me a moment.  AGENT (Manfred): As mentioned in the Terms of Service -  "Our website, products, and services may be unavailable from time to time due to human, digital, mechanical, telecommunication, software, and other failures. We cannot predict or control when such downtime may occur and cannot control the duration of such downtime."  USER: you call "two years" from time to time?  AGENT (Manfred): The connection highly depends on the ISP as well.  USER: that's not a decent corporation should behave. Your service is to get customers pass internet restriction regardless of countries. if you can't do, you should refund their money. Coming up with excuses like "working hard on a solution" for almost two years is beyond any decent human excuse. It may be forgivable if its a few months. Look at your competitor Express, they have came up with a new protocol. If you can't do that, you shouldn't advertise it worked. As of right now, you still advertise your service work in China on windows, that is fraudulent advertising. Not a decent corporation should behave. And you should not work for such a company that cheat people and keep coming up with excuses.   AGENT (Manfred): The Windows application should have worked for our customers before the recent issue. There is not much we can do when it comes to these restrictions.  AGENT (Manfred): If all of our servers are being blocked by the ISP at the moment, then I can't do much at the moment.  Do NOT purchase Nord service if you are a user in China.

The "Success" team has stopped answering my questions and is now blocking me since Microsoft constantly sends me undeliverable messages.  Nord has no dispute resolution mechanism the the bots in support are the only point of contact. title: Poor Customer Service.
text: I got an email in January that came across as a renewal notice for my service contract and paid it.  I knew it was due in the New Year but being ill with COVID and a bad fall I just paid it and then got another renewal notice in March.  Having been ill with what turned out to be an ongoing concussion from the fall I pd it but in the back of my mind I thought I had pd it.  So I logged in and checked my bank and NordVPM acct and found I had paid in January and March.  You can't call them you can only communicate on line which is a lengthy matter when you have an idiot on the other end who can't understand what you are telling them.  I loaded the bank and the Nord VPN acct details showing I had paid twice.  After a lengthy back and forth typing of messages I finally thought she understood as she said she would cancel both payments,  I have it in writing and she agreed not to cancel my Nord protection until I had paid a new renewal.  Why I had to have both cancelled I didn't know but after a frustrating conversation it was agreed she would cancel both payments and I would renew once the refund came thru.  Firstly my Nord protection was removed and when I checked my bank acct the only refund I had was from the March pmt.  So I contacted them again.  The person I spoke to read the history of the last chat and said the January pmt was for a special Nord service I have NEVER used.  I still don't understand what it is for.  I just wanted basic coverage I am a pensioner who uses the net to shop online and stay in contact with family.  The person I spoke to said if I had cancelled the first pmt within 30 days I would have gotten a refund but it was past that and he could do nothing about it.  If I wanted protection I had to pay again.  He would not respond to the mistakes made by the customer service person in the first message.  It was obvious she just said what she said to get rid of me.  And the next person was not helpful either.  Nord fix your customer service problem because only being able to contact online is not good enough,  If your staff make a mistake as the first person did you should wear their mistake and not make your customer's so freaking angry because I know I was lied too.   Plus your marketing tactics are bordering on fraud.  That first email was made to look like it was a renewal notice for service.  How can you have a renewal notice for a program you have never used or pay for?  I have warned my friends not to use Nord because of the lack of customer service.

title: Never works from China on WinOS. They don't tell you that though!
text: Literally never works from China on PC or Android. Every time you contact customer support they say "its temporarily not working and we are working on it ". Temporarily as in for near a year now! They advertise they have one of the best VPN for China. Its nonsense. If so, why don't they give a one month test, they specifically exclude China or don't sell a one month package. Oh and guess what, they don't give refunds after buying a 2 year package that is effectively useless! Edit , from the response below you can see what they say. (1) They try to infer that its down "temporarily" on windows , (2) We are all aware of the alternative for Android (StrongSwan) but that never works either.  The key point is, this information is nowhere on your webpage when your trying to sell the product. The support team say they don't have this real time connectivity statistics to hand, BS, you simply don't want to advertise that it doesn't work . If you were confident in your product you would offer a refund but you specifically  exclude China from refunds or a trial run.

title: Unethical business practices - do not deal with these people
text: I paid for a one year subscription but decided not to renew, NorVPN have simply gone ahead and charged my credit card, at a much higher price (67% increase compared to last year), They gave no prior warning that they intended to do this nor have they sent confirmation that the money was taken. I have today logged in to my account and find in the "small print" that they state that they will automatically renew the subscription once you have registered a credit card with them. The customer isn't given the option of ticking a box confirming that they wish to renew. They also state that they will send an email about renewal when the subscription expires - this didn't happen and if I had received such an email I would have instructed them not to renew. I have asked them to cancel the subscription and refund the unused amount. If I have read their T&Cs correctly I now see that they don't allow subscriptions to be cancelled. These business practices are totally unethical, verging on fraud in my opinion. I now have to contact Mastercard to tell them the charge wasn't knowingly unauthorised and to instruct them not to accept further charge requests from these people. My advice is to avoid NordVPN and to deal with a company with more acceptable business practices.

title: I've been using NordVPN on my PC and…
text: I've been using NordVPN on my PC and iPhone for a couple of years and it's been a constant annoyance. On my phone, VPN constantly disconnects me from WiFi and blocks all communications. So I need either turn my WiFi off and on or disable the VPN connection. This is really bad so I stopped using VPN on my phone - nothing but annoyance. On my PC it works a bit better, but sometimes it also blocks all communications and I need to restart my computer. It seems there is something with their new authentication process where you need to go online, but you can't because VPN doesn't work. When NordVPN works, it is perfectly fine. But when it doesn't, you feel miserable, especially when you need to check your mail quickly or go online to find something you need just right now, and instead, you need to waste time restarting your computer or services.
